Description: The wine is just now ready to drink. Baked-apple flavors mingle with tropical fruits such as mango and lychee. Pepper and a hint of spice give the wine a twist. It finishes with intense acidity that leaves freshness.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Coustarret 2017 Anie d'Ange  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: Luscious orange and honey flavors flow from this dry wine. With its blend of the two Mansengs, Gros and Petit, and the rare Petit Courbu, it has richness as well as a tight dry, fresh character. The wine is just ready to drink. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lapeyre 2017 Vitatge Vielh  (Jurançon Sec)

Description: This floral wine offers great fruits as well as hints of honey. Produced from late-harvest fruit, the wine has concentration as well as a good balance between freshness and richness. Drink this wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Coustarret 2018 Anie d'Ange  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: This full-throttle sticky, as the Aussies say, is a blend of Viognier, Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and Pinot Gris. It's late picked with some botrytis left to form, giving it added complexity. Radiant amber and green-rimmed in glass, it opens with notes of roasted salted nuts, lemon curd, marmalade and marzipan with the earthy funk of Noble Rot. The palate is ultrarich and luscious with intense sweetness, like it could be poured over a bowl of ice cream. Sip with a nutty, citrusy dessert or aged cheese.                      Christina Pickard
Name: D'Arenberg 2017 The Noble Mud Pie White (Adelaide)

Description: The first impression in this wine is richness. Texture is dense and the dry wine is packed with ripe white and mango fruits, spice and honey. It's a little young, so drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Coustarret 2018 Renaissance  (Jurançon Sec)

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti Classico, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made of 60% Trebbiano and 40% Malvasia grapes, this has aromas recalling dried apricot, vanilla and toasted almond. The opulent palate offers acacia honey, apricot jam, caramel and candied orange peel. It's well-balanced with a long finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Volpaia 2014  Vin Santo del Chianti Classico

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti Classico, Tuscany, Italy
Description: A 50/50 blend of dried Trebbiano and Malvasia grapes, this dessert wine opens with inviting aromas of maple syrup, toasted hazelnut and marzipan. The concentrated palate offers chestnut honey, dried fig and sweet almond flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Losi Querciavalle 2006  Vin Santo del Chianti Classico

Description: Made with organically grown Vermentino and Colombana grapes, this lovely, tangy white offers aromas of yellow stone fruit, citrus and Mediterranean herbs. On the savory palate, fresh acidity accompanies ripe apricot, grapefruit and almond before an orange drop candy close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria Fibbiano 2019 Fonte delle Donne White (Toscana)

Description: While this is a rich wine, it always keeps freshness in mind. That shows in the orange-zest tang and passion-fruit flavor. Like so many wines, even dry ones, made mainly from Petit Manseng, it has a touch of honey. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Coustarret 2017 Renaissance  (Jurançon Sec)

Description: This entry level label from Marlborough winery Huia consistently delivers bang for buck. This vintage the blend is dominated by Gruner Veltliner, trailed by Sauvignon Blanc with a little Pinot Gris, Chardonnay and Riesling for a tasty, balanced drop. Delicate aromas of honey, ginger and sun-kissed orchard fruit and their blossoms lead. An almost unexpected dagger of acidity slices through the bright apple, pear and citrus fruit on the palate but is neatly balanced by a gentle textural element and a lengthy finish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Hunky Dory 2020 Tangle Made With Organic Grapes White (Marlborough)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: An herbaceous, peppery aroma leads to richer, riper, fruitier flavors of peaches, cream and toasted almonds in this full-bodied wine. Good concentration and length make it even more appealing.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sol Rouge 2018 Gypsy Blanc White (Lake County)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: Petit Manseng weaves its magic in this rich, sweet late-harvest wine. Honey, spice and rich apricot flavors are augmented and contrasted with elegant acidity that brings freshness at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2017 Château Arricau-Bordes  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)

Description: Made with Trebbiano, Sauvignon Blanc, Chardonnay and Traminer and vinified in cement clayvers, this is almost an orange wine. Medium-bodied and smooth, with a glycerin-like texture, it has multifaceted aromas including honey, ripe grapefruit, lychee, Spanish broom and dried yellow stone fruit. The aromas carry over to the palate along with mineral, lemon drop candy and a yeasty whiff of bread dough. Tangy acidity lifts the rich flavors. It's unusual, compelling and delicious.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello dei Rampolla 2019 Trebianco White (Toscana)

Description: Dry citrus aromas are topped by vanilla, lees and creamy oak scents. Core acidity cuts the roundness and lactic oak that thicken the palate, while this tastes of briny pear and apple along with vanilla. A strong oak character lingers on a generous finish; drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2018 Organza White (Rioja)

Description: Gros Manseng, Petit Courbu and Petit Manseng have come together in this richly complex wine. Along with tastes of lemon and honey that are filled out with spice and ripe acidity, the peach and kiwi flavors are powerful and intense. Drink the wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2019 Cirque Nord Grande Cuvée  (Saint-Mont)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This medium-sweet wine, a blend of the two Manseng grapes, offers tastes of quince, honey and yellow fruits. Flavors bounce off the texture and acidity, balancing a wine that is both fresh and rich. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Guillaman 2019 Frisson d'Automne White (Côtes de Gascogne)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: Made with 40% Trebbiano, 40% Malvasia and 20% between Chardonnay, Sauvignon and Pinot Bianco, this has enticing aromas of elderflower, citrus and yellow stone fruit. Aged 50% in steel and 50% in large barrels, the medium-bodied palate features juicy grapefruit, apricot and toasted hazelnut alongside tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Colombaio di Cencio 2019 Colombaio Bianco White (Toscana)

Description: Briny stone-fruit and apple aromas include the slightest note of vegetal funk, while this blend dominated by Viura and Maturana Blanca feels minerally and healthy. Salty, lightly briny green-melon and citrus flavors persist through the finish. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Nivarius 2016 Edición Limitada White (Rioja)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe aromas of green and yellow fruits, from melon to Key lime to peach, show on the nose of this blend of 80% Sauvignon Blanc, 15% Grenache Blanc and 5% Viognier, as does a cement-like minerality. The mouthfeel is taut, with flavors ranging from lime peel to riper melon.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: ONX 2019 Field Day White (Templeton Gap District)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Currently run by the sixth generation, this estate brings out the natural freshness of the region's climate. In this attractive wine, bright white and yellow fruits harmonize with the lively acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Guillaman 2020 Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: This dry wine from Pacherenc is rich, with touches of honey as well as green-apple and spice flavors. The zesty blend of Gros Manseng with Petit Courbu brings out yellow fruits and rich acidity at the end. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2019 Lou Blanc  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This estate in the north of the Gascony region has produced a crisp and bright wine. Along with all this freshness, the wine has a zesty, mineral edge that gives it a final bite. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2020 Domaine de Cassaigne Le Labyrinthe White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A tantalizing mix of aromatic herbal flavors and hints of honey marks this fresh wine, with a crisp citrus texture and lively acidity. This light-alcohol blend of Colombard and Gros Manseng is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2020 BIG Born in Gascony White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: With a majority of Colombard, this wine is green and crisp. Ripe fruitiness and red-apple richness provide a slight relief from the intensity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2020 Brumes de Gascogne Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Colombard and Sauvignon Blanc layer herbal and crisp green flavors on top of each other, giving an aromatic, bright wine full of citrus. Touches of richer kiwi and clementine flavors bring intensity to the acidity. Drink this light-alcohol wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2020 Colombelle Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: A blend of 26% Chenin Blanc, 26% Chardonnay, 23% Roussanne, 21% Verdelho and 4% Muscat, this opens with initial aromas of toasted apple, spiced pear, peach pit and pie crust, with a hint of singed orange peel in the back. The medium-bodied palate shows good fruit richness graced with a lovely toasty overlay. It sounds decadent, but superbly bright and vibrant acidity and a saline freshness on the finish keep it all in balance.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Alheit 2017 Hemelrand Vine Garden White (Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge)

Description: Tasmania is Australia's coolest climate winegrowing region, and this small-batch label from winemaker Samantha Connew deftly expresses the region's capacity for elegant and refreshing wines. Tupelo is made of 57% Pinot Gris, 32% Riesling and 11% Gewürztraminer. The blend is a lithe expression of each variety. Delicate notes of rose water, orange and honey-flecked pear are accompanied by a light spritz when first opened, offering a lovely texture and crystalline acidity. This is a thirst-quenching drop that would pair perfectly with a wide range of Southeast Asian cuisine.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Stargazer 2019 Tupelo White (Tasmania)

Description: This is a field blend of nearly equal parts Sémillon, Pinot Blanc and Chardonnay, with a smaller amount of Sauvignon Blanc. Flavors of vanilla, peach and toasted oak sit on a fresh and elegant palate, with subtle earthy accents chiming in.                      Virginie Boone
Name: De Sante 2019 L'Atelier White (Napa Valley)

Description: A blend of 90% Chenin Blanc and 10% Sémillon, this just screams Chenin from the glass, thanks to notes of waxed melon rind, crisp pear slices, lightly toasted apple and pressed yellow flowers. The medium-weight palate feels round and filling on entry, but is then picked up after the sip thanks to focused acidity and a light astringent texture that lends length to the finish. Overall, this is well-balanced and ready to go now and through 2026.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Alheit 2018 Cartology Bush Vines Naturally Fermented White (Western Cape)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied blend is complex, somewhat oaky and nicely dry, presenting aromas of bread dough, almond and butter followed by poached pear and almond flavors on a nicely firm texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Baca 2019 Stargazing White (Mendocino County)

Description: This is a smooth, ripe and lightly textured wine. Hints of tropical fruits and a rounded mouthfeel are lifted by acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Sanguinhal 2019 White (Lisboa)

Description: Light bodied and fruity, this sunny wine is packed with honeydew-melon and banana flavors accented by vanilla. It feels mouthfilling, slightly sweet and low in acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Apothic 2019 Winemaker's Blend White (California)

Description: This field blend includes Sauvignon Vert, Sémillon, Pinot Blanc and Chardonnay. Together, they sing harmoniously and turn into a crisp, fresh and lightly styled wine. It offers flavors of lemon, lime and blossoms, with a finishing note of green apple.                      Virginie Boone
Name: De Sante 2018 The Old Vines White (Napa Valley)

Description: With the honeyed freshness of Petit Manseng, this dry wine has ripeness, apricot and crisp lemon fruits and a texture that pushes the wine forward into a rich future. Full in the mouth, the wine will likely be ready from 2022. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lapeyre 2015 Mantoulan  (Jurançon Sec)

Description: Portuguese blending is sometimes a mystery. How did Chardonnay, Marsanne, Roussanne and Sémillon end up in one wine? Except that it works effortlessly with a wine that is now mature, boasting pineapple, apricot and spice flavors in an impressive combination. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta do Pinto 2016 Grande Escolha White (Lisboa)

Description: This rich and well-balanced wine is packed with luxurious but not overwhelming toast, almond, butter and vanilla flavors that blend with a core of Anjou pear. It's full bodied, well rounded in texture and nicely balanced by acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Donkey & Goat 2019 Gadabout White (California)

Description: The result of a tasting by two wine professionals, this is a rich blend, now mature, of Gros Manseng, Arrufiac and Petit Courbu. It shows the wide variety and longevity of local grapes in the Gascony region. Offering spice, lemon and a mature perfumed character, this enticing wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2010 Le Faîte Blanc  (Saint-Mont)

Description: Intricate peach, almond and pistachio flavors are backed by zingy acidity in this flavorful, lively and well-balanced wine. It offers a fascinating spectrum of flavors and a refreshing, lively texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rootdown 2019 Es Okay White (Mendocino)

Description: From vines dating back to the 1940s, this wine is rich in its intensity and concentration. Powerful and ripe green fruit and citrus flavors are lightly touched with honey, typical of the two Manseng grapes. It is now ready to drink. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lapeyre 2016 Vitatge Vielh  (Jurançon Sec)

Description: Gros Manseng, Arrufiac and Petit Courbu come together in this dry blend. The rich, honeyed character also emphasizes the acidity and the pear and kiwi fruits, shot through with spice and pepper from wood aging. Drink this wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2018 Le Faîte Blanc  (Saint-Mont)

Description: Lush fruit flavors are lavishly accented by vanilla, butter and caramel in this full-bodied, soft-textured wine. Poached pears and honeydew-melon flavors fill it out nicely, giving a relaxed sense of sweetness.                      Jim Gordon
Name: The Prisoner 2019 Blindfold White (California)

Appellation: Los Angeles County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Delicate white-flower aromas of honeysuckle and yucca bloom meet with crisp, aromatic apple slices on the nose of this blend of 72% Sauvignon Blanc, 18% Sémillon and 10% Viognier. There's a tang of lemon and grapefruit peel on the palate, with warmer yet fresh hints of mango and coconut as well.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Byron Blatty 2019 Aurora White (Los Angeles County)

Description: The gold color shows that this is a mature wine and one that conveys the aging power of the Gros Manseng grape. Keeping a strong citrus character along with tight acidity, it also brings in more tropical flavors and ripe spiciness. This is a lesson in longevity. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2009 Château Saint-Go  (Saint-Mont)

Description: This lush, ripe and opulent wine offers bold aromas of vanilla, butter and banana followed by plump peach and poached pear flavors. A full body and a nicely viscous texture are pleasant on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: The Prisoner 2018 Blindfold White (California)

Description: This is mostly Riesling (83%), with the rest Muscat Blanc and Roussanne. Aromas of lychee, pink grapefruit rind and white flowers jump from the glass. Dry, sleek and focused lemon and iced tea flavors follow, hanging around on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Huston 2019 Chicken Dinner White

Appellation: Los Angeles County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Not only is this brand elevating the past and future of Los Angeles wine, it's using obscure, but possibly climate-right, grapes to do so. This blend of 35% Godello, 35% Loureiro and 30% Treixadura shows honey-cake, walnut-cream and hot sandstone aromas on the nose. It's nutty and creamy on the rich palate, with cashew and baked stone-fruit elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: Alonso Family Vineyard White Field Blend
Name: Angeleno 2019 Alonso Family Vineyard White Field Blend White (Los Angeles County)

Description: This classic white blend offers smoke, spice, flint and herbs on the nose, with a touch of citrus lift. On the palate, it's herbaceous but pert, with sea salt, pepper, spice and lemon flavors.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Tsantali 2019 Abaton White (Mount Athos)

Description: Rich, smoothly textured (although with just a tang of bright acidity), this is a wood-aged wine with a fine balance. Acidity and fresh lemons contrast with the wine's riper apple and pear flavors in a blend that will age further. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta do Pinto 2018 Viognier-Chardonnay (Lisboa)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Consisting mostly of Muscat Ottonel, the aromas pop, with notes of Mandarin orange spritz, flower and honey. It delights by drinking just about bone-dry, remaining light on its feet, and bringing structure rarely seen for the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Calendar 2019 White (Yakima Valley)

Description: A lemon peel aroma meets with pithy Asian pear and jicama on the nose of this blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Gris and Viognier. Light grapefruit, green pear and honeysuckle flavors unfold on the clean and fresh palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Iron Oaks 2019 Flipside White (California)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: The two Manseng grapes come together in this rich wine that is full of white fruits, with riper hints of pineapple. The wine is still young and full of fruitiness, with concentrated acidity that needs to soften. Drink the wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Famille Laplace 2018 Odé d'Aydie  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Billowing aromas of ripe peach, jasmine, oolong tea and honeycomb carry the nose of this blend of Gewürztraminer and Vignoles that spent 14 days on the skins. The palate is dry, with a gentle smokiness surrounding flavors of peach and white flowers. Juicy acidity and a thin blanket of tannins frame it all, making this an interesting orange wine expression.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Atwater 2017 Skin Ferment White (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Bright aromas of white blossoms, candied lemon peels and orchard fruit carry the nose of this blend of Viognier, Pinot Gris, Sauvignon Blanc and Riesling. Juicy citrus and yellow plum flavors are housed on a juicy, easy-to-like palate.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Pindar Vineyards 2019 Dr. Dan's Signature Collections White (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: The local Loin de l'Oeil grape (the name means far from the eye, because it's difficult to spot the bunches) makes up 85% of this wine, giving it lemon and kiwi fruit flavors. These gain richness from touches of spice and creamed pear. Drink this perfumed, still-young wine from late 2021. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Rotier 2019 Les Gravels Blanc White (Gaillac)

Description: Young and poised between sweetness and dryness, this wine has the good acidity that comes from the two Manseng grapes. Orange zest and fruitiness give freshness, with a rich undercurrent from the late-harvest fruit. Drink the wine now. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lapeyre 2019 Lapeyre Moelleux  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: This white blend offers an intriguing nose of citrus spice, matchstick and flowers, followed by vanilla spice, smoke, herbs and lemon fruit. Its finish is minerally and clean.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Santo Wines 2018 ASPA Volcanic Terroir White (Santorini)

Description: Pretty floral and citrus aromas give this white blend immediate appeal. On the palate, it's fruity with a nice zap of acidity throughout. The wine is easy to drink and offers a delicate balance of minerals and fleshier flavor.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Nasiakos 2019 White (Mantinia)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A typical Gascon blend of Colombard and Ugni Blanc is perfumed with Gros Manseng. The result is this brightly textured, crisp wine that has a tangy citrus character along with friendly white fruits. Drink this wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine la Taste 2019 Harmonie de la Taste White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is difficult to categorize. It shows a slight tawny tinge in its color, has a chalky mineral-like aromas and offers a toasted almond flavor. It leans heavily toward a savory, earthy expression.                      Jim Gordon
Name: E16 2019 Baby Rattlesnake Vineyard Viognier-Grenache Blanc (El Dorado)

Description: Grapefruit, pineapple and peach are juicy and forward in this alphabet-soup blend of Faberrebe, Silvaner, Bacchus, Kerner and Huxelrebe grapes. Medium-sweet and balanced by bright tangerine acidity, it's an easy-drinking, straightforward sip that's best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Leonard Kreusch 2019 Weinkellerei Kreusch Spätlese White (Rheinhessen)

Description: This global blend is made from 83% Sauvignon Blanc sourced from New York's North Fork and 17% Vermentino from the Languedoc in France. Aromas of ripe pineapple, lemon and kerosene lead to the rounded, juicy palate. The fruit gets a bit muddled, not showing much definition or purity, but there's decent lift from bright acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Designation: French-American Blend No. 2. Julia's Sauvignon Blend
Name: Maiden + Liberty 2017 French-American Blend No. 2. Julia's Sauvignon Blend White (Global)

Description: A juicy ripeness is projected by the aromas of pear and apricot on the nose. These are followed by a sense of earthy richness and a slightly honeyed edge. The palate then focuses on a yeast tone that gives so much texture to this full-fruited wine. There is a vein of freshness, too, that pulls everything into focus.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wieninger 2019 Nussber Ried Ulm White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: A fully oaked but elegant nose with notes of vanilla, lemon curd and melon makes a big statement, while this is gorgeous on the palate, with weight and piercing acidity. Flavors of vanilla, wood grain, fresh corn, golden apple and melon finish long and classy. This is a superb white Rioja based mostly on Chardonnay. Enjoy through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Tobía 2018 White (Rioja)

Description: Honeyed richness is carried on the very first whiff. More air then reveals dried apricot, blossom honey and ripe Amalfi lemon zest. The concentrated palate, however, homes in on the zesty part and channels the undoubted richness, almost unctuousness of this wine into fine, clear freshness. This has body and curve, power and concentration but also finesse. Drink by 2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wieninger 2018 Nussberg Ried Rosengartl White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: This wine is a blend of 79% Sauvignon Blanc and 21% Sémillon, fermented in a mix of Acacia, neutral French oak, stainless steel and concrete egg. The texture is stony and silky, with fresh flavors of peach, melon and blood orange.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Groth 2019 Estate White (Oakville)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The white Burgundian blend is a lost, or perhaps never found, art in the New World, but Jim Clendenen's blend of 55% Pinot Gris, 40% Pinot Blanc and 5% Aligoté always makes one wonder why. Aromas of freshly squeezed lemon, honeysuckle, grapefruit peel, Asian pear and light pecan lead into a texturally taut palate that blends brisk citrus and warm, salty flavors seamlessly.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Au Bon Climat 2018 Hildegard White (Santa Maria Valley)

Description: The lovely scent of ripe, green pear is imbued with hints of orange peel and gentle yeastiness. The palate continues in the same aromatic fashion, fusing rounded, orange and pear-scented ripeness and a creamy texture that seems to be spiked with ripe lemon zest. Residual carbon dioxide makes for a little extra spritz that enhances these flavors beautifully.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Fuhrgassl-Huber 2019 Ried Gollin Nussberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This uncommon blend of 50% Viognier and 50% Chardonnay works quite well, beginning with aromas of toast and pear flesh as well as grapefruit skin and wet rock. The palate combines apricot and nectarine with sea salt and toasted nuts.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lindquist Family 2019 Viognier-Chardonnay (Central Coast)

Description: Made from a blend of vintages (2015, 2016 and 2017) of Trebbiano d'Abruzzo aged in amphora, this rich, textural white offers waves of crisp yellow apple, white plum, lemon peel and chamomile flavors. Integrated acidity and a gentle stony grip lend support. Drink soon for best enjoyment.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Francesco Cirelli NV Amphora 15+16+17 Organic White (Italy)

Description: Here is a well-balanced, five-grape blend in which nothing dominates, and all work together harmoniously. It's a mix of Sauvignon Blanc, Chardonnay and Sémillon, with small percentages of Viognier and Gewürztraminer. Peach, apricot and guava flavors dominate in a full-bodied, almost fleshy wine that seems designed for early consumption.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Stratus 2018 White (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This unique, twist-top blend of 80% Grüner Veltliner and 20% Riesling is Graham Tatomer's white table wine, and it begins with aromas of dried lime peels and rocky seashore. The palate also shows dried lime and orange peels, as well as unique flashes of white pepper and thyme.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tatomer 2019 Hinter der Mauer White (Central Coast)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Though a white wine blending 70% Chardonnay and 30% Pinot Noir may seem surprising, it's really a white Pinot with no color or skin contact that's in the mix, and the match-up is quite successful. Apple, pear, peach and apricot fruit flavors are front and center, and the all-stainless fermentation keeps the fruit fresh and clean. Just a lick of butterscotch adds an interesting note to the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Panther Creek 2019 White Blend White (Willamette Valley)

Description: A blend of 80% Grillo and 20% Viognier, this fragrant white opens with heady aromas of white rose, yellow stone fruit and Mediterranean brush. The bright, savory palate doles out ripe yellow peach, grapefruit and lemon drop alongside the barest hint of graphite. Crisp acidity energizes the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Stemmari 2018 Dalila Riserva White (Sicilia)

Description: Floral white-fruit aromas are light, smooth and typical of textbook Galician Albariño. The mouthfeel is tight and zesty, with citric acidity and a sense of stony minerality. Tangerine, lime and green apple flavors are acid driven through the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Pazo de Seoane 2019 Rosal White (Rías Baixas)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: White Sky is principally Pinot Gris, with Viognier, Pinot Blanc and Chardonnay making up the last 16%. Light straw in color, it's fruity top to bottom, with ripe apple and peach flavors. In the mouth it's granular and appealing, with lovely sweetness to the palate from the ripe fruit.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: R. Stuart & Co. 2018 Love, Oregon White Sky White (Willamette Valley)

Description: Delicate aromas of white peach, lemon peel and melon arise on the nose of this blend of Trebbiano, Passerina and Chardonnay. It's light in feel on the palate, offering lifted orchard fruit flavors that end brisk and clean.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Illuminati 2019 Lumeggio White (Controguerra)

Description: A blend of Trebbiano and Pecorino, this white offers ripe tones of white plum and yellow apple accented by dried chamomile. It's rounded and full in feel, filled out by juicy white fruit flavors that show nice initial intensity but fall short on the finish. Still, it's a pleasing, textural white that is balanced by fresh acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cirelli la Collina Biologica 2018 Organic White (Italy)

Description: Made with 90% Catarratto and 10% Chardonnay, this has aromas of yellow spring flower, flint and white stone fruit. On the medium-bodied palate, tangy acidity accompanies yellow apple, grapefruit and a hint of saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenute Orestiadi 2017 Il Bianco di Ludovico Riserva White (Sicilia)

Description: A blend of Catarratto and Insolia, this racy white offers aromas of honeysuckle, citrus and yellow stone fruit. It's crisp and tangy, offering juicy white grapefruit and yellow peach alongside a hint of saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Baglio di Pianetto 2019 Murriali White (Monreale)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The four nobles blended here as an homage to the wines of Alsace are Pinot Gris, Riesling, Gewürztraminer and Muscat. It's the Pinot Gris that dominates, with the rest adding a spare hint of floral aromatics. The clean but simple apple fruit flavors lack much impact, and overall it's a pleasant, generic white wine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2018 Four Nobles Cuvée Blanc White (Willamette Valley)

Description: Reserved aromas of fennel pollen, white plum and lemon carry the nose of this Trebbiano-lead blend. It's light in feel on the palate, showing brisk flavors of citrus and melon. While well balanced by bright acidity, the light intensity of fruit leaves you wanting more.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Masciarelli 2019 Villa Gemma White (Colline Teatine)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This smooth, soft wine offers comfy, ripe pear and apple flavors, with a few floral and vanilla accents on a rich texture and full body.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Winery by the Creek NV Way White (Fair Play)

Description: Waxy, stalky aromas lack vivacity and ripeness, while this unusual blend of Chardonnay, Malvasia, Viura and Tempranillo Blanco is round in feel but flat. Bland pear and melon flavors quickly give way to bitterness, which is maintained across the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Casa La Rad 2017 Solarce White (Rioja)

Description: This is a soft, fruity and just off-dry wine. Grapefruit flavors have a honeyed edge and fruity acidity. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Maison Bertrand Ravache 2019 Cuvée Origine 1749 White (Périgord)

Description: This light-bodied wine tastes clean and straightforward, showing very fruity, appley, melony flavors and a soft texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Three Wishes NV White (America)

Description: This blend of Galego Dourado, Arinto and Ratinho is aged for 15 years in wood and comes from Portugal's smallest appellation. The long wood aging of this wine has given it an intensity that comes from great concentration. It has a beautiful texture and touches of honey and spice that are memorable. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Villa Oeiras NV Superior White (Carcavelos)

Description: Five local grapes, including three that are rare, go into this wood-aged wine. It is a selection from the best of the vintage from each grape, giving a rich wine that is finely balanced and now mature. The wood aging shows as do the kiwi and white fruit flavors. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Cauhapé 2017 C de Cauhapé  (Jurançon Sec)

Description: This coferment combines the aromatic white varieties TWR is renowned for: Gewürztraminer, Riesling and Pinot Gris. Quiet at first, it offers delicate aromas of red apple and pear skins, peach, lime blossoms, honeysuckle and a mineral streak that shows more prominently as the wine warms in glass. It's the palate that really strikes gold—slippery but fresh and elegant, with a whisper of sweetness and a long limey finish. Ultrafood friendly, it combines the best of all three varieties into a soft-spoken wine from a sensitive and skilled winemaker.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Te Whare Ra 2019 Toru Single Vineyard 5182 White (Marlborough)

Description: Half-and-half Petit and Gros Manseng, this dry wine has touches of honey and apricots as well as deliciously rich ripe apples. As a contrast to all this fruitiness, this fine wine is textured and perfumed and is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Cauhapé 2017 Quatre Temps  (Jurançon Sec)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Presented in a 500 ml aluminum bottle that's refillable and recyclable, vintner Jake Bilbro combines 95% Chardonnay and 5% Grenache Blanc into a delicious, gulpable package of bright stone fruit and pineapple, with plenty of underlying acidity to keep it fresh and crisp.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Revelshine 2019 White (Russian River Valley)

Description: This is a rare fortified wine, aged for seven years in wood, made in protected Carcavelos vineyards two miles from the ocean west of Lisbon. With a golden color and plenty of wood and spice flavors, the wine with its richness and link between sweet fruits and drier wood-aged flavors, deserves to be better known.                      Roger Voss
Name: Villa Oeiras NV White (Carcavelos)

Description: This is a relatively unusual—but, in this vintage anyway, harmonious—blend of Pinot Gris, Chardonnay and Riesling. Aromas rush from the glass: lime oil, red apple skins, orchard blossoms and more subtle dried herbal notes. The palate is highly textured, chalky yet slippery, with zesty acidity and a saline finish. A few more years in bottle should offer it a more honeyed complexity. Drink now through 2027.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Paddy Borthwick 2018 Paper Road CPR White (Wairarapa)

Description: A blend that includes rare local grapes such as Camaralet, Petit Courbu and Lauzet gives complexity and great richness to the two primary Manseng grapes. It's an impressive evocation of the region—rich, spicy, citrusy and ready to drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Cauhapé 2019 Geyser  (Jurançon Sec)

Description: Vintner Jake Bilbro goes back to his roots here, as the son of Marietta Cellars' founder and winemaker Chris Bilbro, in this deliciously approachable, cheerful white. Combining 80% Chardonnay with the remainder a mix of Riesling, Gewürztraminer, Trousseau Gris, Grenache Blanc and Berger, it's a tribute to simpler times that remains flavorful, textured and bright.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Winemaker's Folly 2019 Chapter 1 Vino Blanco White (Sonoma County)

Description: Crisp acidity allied to pineapple and kiwi flavors give this wine both freshness and bold, vibrant acidity. The wine, a blend of Gros Manseng and Camaralet, is ripe, touched by pepper and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Cauhapé 2019 Chant des Vignes  (Jurançon Sec)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: A blend of half-and-half Chenin and Chardonnay, this is deliciously crisp. Apple flavors come through the lively mousse to give an elegant wine. It is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine la Croix des Vainqueurs NV Brut Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Crémant de Loire)

Description: In pursuit of its enlightened policy of finding and developing old local and native varieties, this producer has blended Gros Manseng, Petit Courbu and Arrufiac into a fresh while also richly creamy wine. Its sliced apple flavors shine out, bringing acidity and ripeness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Secret Vines 2018 Reborn Varietals Gros Manseng-Petit Courbu-Arrufiac  (Saint-Mont)

Description: A blend of 60% Malvasia and 40% Zibibbo, this white delivers detailed aromas of apricot, potpourri, ripe lemon and sun-dried hay. There's a pleasing roundness to the palate, with a delicately viscous texture that's propped up by integrated acidity. Flavors of apple, apricot and dried hay are lifted by tangy orange-laden acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Benvenuto 2018 Mare White (Calabria)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Boisterous aromas of poached pear, gardenia and guava are ripe but cleanly presented on the nose of this blend of 50% Viognier, 27% Albarino and 23% Grenache Blanc. Strong peach-blossom-oil and tropical tones show on the palate, but it's zesty and lively to sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wolff 2019 White Wolff White (San Luis Obispo County)

Description: A blend of Gros Manseng. Petit Courbu and Arrufiac, this wine comes from three local varieties that are showing their quality. The wine is rich with ripe white fruits, tangy acidity and intense freshness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2018 Les Cépages Préservés  (Saint-Mont)

Description: Buttery oak aromas are out front on this barrel-aged Petit Manseng (with 10% Viognier). A plump palate is ripe and round on first take, then softer and flatter on the back end. Apple, saline, tropical-fruit and citrus flavors are a mixed bag, albeit a good one, while this runs short on the finish. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Cerro Chapeu 2019 Gran Tradición White (Montevideo)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This ancient estate, just south of the Armagnac town of Condom, is managed by the Plaimont cooperative. This wine is fresh and fruity, touched with honey and apricots as well as bright citrus flavors. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2018 Domaine de Cassaigne Grand Vin White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Unique for the region, this white is a blend of Müller-Thurgau and Traminer. It starts off with brisk aromas of Mandarin orange and white flowers that carry to the silken, sultry palate. There's low verve to the pear and stone-fruit flavors, making this a wine to enjoy in the near term.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Re Manfredi 2018 White (Basilicata)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: With its blend of Colombard and Gros Manseng, this wine brings together ripe fruitiness of kiwi and fresh currants, all tied up with acidity. The wine is attractive and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Saint-Lannes 2019 Signature White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: A half-and-half blend of Chardonnay and Chenin Blanc, this wine comes from Benoist family estate. Full of white fruits and nutty apple flavors, the wine is crisply textured and refreshing. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Vieil Orme NV Cuvée Gabriel Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Crémant de Loire)

Description: A generalized white-fruit nose leads to a full and round palate whose heft is balanced by healthy acidity. Chunky flavors of honeydew melon and banana finish warm and with mild oak spice. Drink this full-bodied Chardonnay blend now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Familia Deicas 2019 Preludio Barrel Select Lote N°24 White (Juanico)

Description: A blend of Greco and Mantonico, this white offers a decently rich nose of apricot and sun-dried hay. The medium-bodied palate shows plush flavors of orchard fruit and melon, with fresh enough acidity keeping it all in check. It ends ripe and open, making this a solid offering for those who enjoy fuller-bodied, soft white wines.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Statti 2018 White (Lamezia)

Appellation: Val di Neto, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A blend of 90% Chardonnay and 10% Sauvignon Blanc, this white starts off with subtle aromas of peach, apple and sea spray. The light-bodied palate is bright and crisp in orchard-fruit flavors that are lifted by lemon-tinged acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Librandi 2018 Critone White (Val di Neto)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Gascogne is Gascony in English, and this wine celebrates the light and fresh white wines from the region. This naturally dry Gascon wine blend of Colombard and Gros Manseng has touches of honey as well fresh currants and tight, brilliant acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2019 Big Born in Gascony White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Apple and pear aromas are light and clean, leading to a lively palate, with fleshy roundness offset by snappy acidity. Peach and citrus flavors are tangy, with a touch of sweetness. On the finish, this patio-friendly Albariño blend (containing Chardonnay and Verdejo) is smooth and clean, with a lasting note of apple.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Establecimiento Juanico 2020 Don Pascual Coastal Albariño Blend White (Juanico)

Description: With no added sulfites, this hazy, slightly spritzy white is made from Pinot Bianco. Aromas of pear juice, tangerine and citron carry to the medium-bodied palate. A gentle tone of savory yeast lends some grip to the fruity tones, ending briskly on a lemon-kissed banana note.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Taverna 2019 SenSO2 White (Basilicata)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: The crisp, cool and classic Gascon blend of Colombard, Sauvignon Blanc and Gros Manseng has yielded a bright, crisp wine, light as a feather and refreshingly fruity. With its light touch and lively acidity, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2019 Pyrène Cuvée Marine White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Vino Bianco d'Italia, Italy Other, Italy
Description: Aromas of lemon curd, lemongrass and shortbread carry the nose of this Fiano. A slight spritz on the palate dissipates quickly to reveal flavors of lemon and pear that mingle with a savory yeast tone. Lifted acidity ensures a brisk, clean ending.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Basilisco 2019 Sophia Biologico White (Vino Bianco d'Italia)

Description: Musk and candied lemon fill the nose with lifted, heady intensity while the palate is a vision of purest, ripest, sweetest apricot. The intensity and purity of flavors is heightened by candied lemon sharpness, piercing, framing and illuminating that golden apricot deliriousness. The finish is long, and the life of this immensely pure wine will be even longer.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Ruster Ausbruch Auf den Flügeln der Morgenröte
Name: Heidi Schröck 2017 Ruster Ausbruch Auf den Flügeln der Morgenröte White (Burgenland)

Description: A hint of musk, a touch of vanilla and the promise of creaminess starts this off. On the palate, this vision blossoms into apricot-scented sweetness and concentrated richness of apricot compote. All this is pervaded by equally concentrated freshness, piercing through with lemony brightness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gunter Triebaumer 2018 Ruster Ausbruch White (Burgenland)

Description: Notions of the cooked peel of quince and quince jelly align with vanilla to create a fruity, spicy but mellow nose. The flavors intensify on the immensely concentrated, viscous body where hints of apricot and Mirabelle plum join the quince jelly notes. A lovely vein of freshness makes these aromatics even more distinct. The richness is immense.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Nouvelle Vague Grande Cuvée Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 6
Name: Kracher 2017 Nouvelle Vague Grande Cuvée Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 6 White (Burgenland)

Description: Ripe melon flesh and quince peel notes on the nose promise savory fruit. The palate bursts in with luscious, intense fruit that spills over with grapefruit zest and gorgeously bitter notions of citrus pith and quince peel while a lightning streak of freshness freezes everything into precision. There is much going on here, riotously so, and despite all the sweetness it is this rapier freshness that makes this moreish. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Heidi Schröck 2018 Beerenauslese White (Burgenland)

Description: A honeyed nose has faint hints of candied lime. On the palate this lime notion turns into the purest, most vivid candied lemon zest. This is intensely, lusciously sweet but also sharp with freshness and zing. Brightness and sweetness are bold and balanced.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: H.&C. Nittnaus 2018 Exquisit Trockenbeerenauslese White (Burgenland)

Description: An immensely aromatic nose presents a vision of candied peach. The golden, honeyed, intense peachiness is even fuller and bolder on the supremely pure palate. The sweetness is intense and luscious, but it is cut by piercing, pristine freshness. A lovely bitter hint of marmalade rounds out this peachy picture, made even richer by a viscous mouthfeel. The finish is fresh and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Zantho 2018 Trockenbeerenauslese White (Burgenland)

Description: At first the nose is subdued, hinting at fresh, white field mushroom and something sonorous and sweet behind it. The palate, however, comes with a high, bright and resplendent note of lemon zest and candied peel freshness that makes the nobly sweet richness even more luscious. This strikes a most eloquent and almost serene balance. The long finish brims with fresh zestiness. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domäne Wachau 2017 Terrassen Beerenauslese White (Wachau)

Description: Made predominantly from Carricante with a drop of Catarratto, this smooth, stunning white offers delicate, enticing scents of Spanish broom, chamomile, ripe white-stone fruit and a whiff of smoke. Savory and loaded with elegance, the medium-bodied, focused palate features juicy Meyer lemon, ripe Bartlett pear, golden apple and tangy, saline mineral notes. Bright acidity lends tension and balance. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tornatore 2019 Pietrarizzo Bianco  (Etna)

Description: The perfume of fir honey and maple syrup promises sweetness and spice in equal measure. The sweetness on the palate intensifies every flavor and presents notions of candied lime, quince jelly, grapefruit zest and barley sugar. The citrus intensity is immense and luminous. This is a very sweet late-harvest style but an uplifting, refreshing one. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Heidi Schröck 2017 Spätlese White (Burgenland)

Description: Musk, rose petal, fir honey and dried fig are the rich aromas on the nose. The intense palate is lusciously sweet and very concentrated, showing a viscous, almost balm-like mouthfeel that seems to burst with luscious fruit. Equally concentrated is the sharp freshness that brings everything alive. What a package. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Steindorfer 2018 Beerenauslese Cuvée Klaus White (Burgenland)

Description: Enticingly fragrant, this blend of Catarratto, Pinot Bianco, Sauvignon and Traminer Aromatic offers heady scents of citrus blossom, yellow stone fruit and ripe pear. The smooth, savory palate doles out yellow peach, pineapple and grapefruit accented by aniseed notes. Tangy acidity gives it a mouthwatering close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2019 Leone d'Almerita White (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This unusual blend is 29% Pinot Blanc, 27% Muscat, 25% Riesling, 11% Pinot Gris and 8% Gewürztraminer. Despite the low percentage, it's the Gewurz that stands out aromatically, and brings those flavors of floral baby powder into the body of the wine. It's not overpowering, however, and the nifty mix of other white grapes fleshes it out with apple, peach, pear and a dash of lemon oil.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brooks 2019 Amycas White (Willamette Valley)

Description: Notes of sun-warmed peach skin and juicy peach compote fill the nose. The palate, concentrated and peachy, brims with juiciness and is laced with wonderful lemon zest brightness. This counters the sweetness and makes it incredibly appetizing. The medium-sweet finish of this late-harvest style still echoes with lemon and peach.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: H.&C. Nittnaus 2019 Spätlese Exquisit White (Burgenland)

Description: Elegant and racy, this blend of 70% Carricante and 30% Catarratto offers enticing scents of white spring blossom, white stone fruit and a whiff of exotic fruit. On the focused palate, crisp acidity accompanies yellow apple, Meyer lemon and saline mineral notes alongside the barest hint of fresh bread dough.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Graci 2019  Etna

Description: Yellow spring flower, hazelnut and yellow-apple aromas form the nose on this organic blend of 90% Carricante and 10% Catarratto. The racy, linear palate features Meyer lemon, Bartlett pear and tangy saline notes alongside crisp acidity. It closes on a hint of bitter almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenute Bosco 2018 Piano dei Daini  (Etna)

Description: Made with organically farmed 80% Carricante, 15% Cataratto and 5% Minnella grapes, this vibrant white opens with aromas of white spring flower, Mediterranean brush and citrus zest. The bright palate offers tangy Meyer lemon, tart green apple and ginger while crisp acidity keeps it fresh. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Terra Costantino 2018  Etna

Description: This light-bodied and ultrasmooth wine wraps fresh melon and fig flavors in a slightly mineral structure, and subtly spices them with vanilla and almond. It's an interesting and enjoyably complex wine blended from Kerner, Bacchus and Riesling grapes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Markus Wine Co 2019 Nativo White (Lodi)

Description: Delicate aromas of spring wildflower, summer orchard fruit and wet stone waft out of the glass along with the barest whiff of petroleum. Racy and linear, the svelte palate offers fresh lemon slice, yellow apple and tangy saline set against vibrant acidity. Made with 90% Carricante and 10% split between Grecanico and Minella, it's linear and savory.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: I Custodi delle Vigne dell'Etna 2018 Ante  (Etna)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a brisk vintage for this blend of 36% Chardonnay, 32% Pinot Blanc and 32% Pinot Gris, with tangy lemon-peel and baked apple aromas on the clean and crisp nose. The palate is quite tight and tart, with apple-skin and lemon-zest flavors that warm only slightly into the finish, where a sandstone-like minerality also shows.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Barden 2018 Fonte White (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a tiny-production field blend from a vineyard planted in 1922 of 59% Muscadelle, 37% French Colombard and 4% Palomino. Stainless-steel fermented and aged in oak, it opens in candied peach, apricot and lime, the palate dry, sleek and offering high-toned freshness.                      Virginie Boone
Designation: Blanc de L'Annee Very Old Vines
Name: Whipsmart Wine Company 2018 Blanc de L'Annee Very Old Vines White (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 58% Chenin Blanc and 42% Sauvignon Blanc, cofermented and with extended maceration. With fruit coming from La Reyna Blanca Vineyard on the Royal Slope, the aromas are bright, with notes of cantaloupe, melon, kiwi skin, banana and apple. Rounded, fresh flavors follow, bringing some weight but with enough acidity to pull it off. It needs time to fully settle in, but there are lots of interesting things happening.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Massalto 2019 Sauvalanche White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Made with 90% Carricante and 10% Catarratto, both organically grown, this has a deep, golden hue and aromas of yellow spring flower, smoke, ripe white stone fruit and a hint of vanilla. The medium-bodied, linear palate shows an understated elegance, suggesting mature yellow apple, hazelnut, unsweetened lemon drop and saline mineral notes framed in fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Terra Costantino 2016 Contrada Blandano  (Etna)

Description: Lean and linear, this has an initially shy nose that eventually reveals citrus zest, Mediterranean scrub and the merest note of kerosene. Vibrant and featuring mineral tension, the racy palate shows white grapefruit, yellow apple and savory saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ampelon 2018  Etna

Description: Vivid lemon and fresh herb flavors light up this medium-bodied wine as good acidity balances a sense of concentration and richness. Made with 95% Torrontes grapes from Lodi it also incorporates 5% of Traminette grapes from North Carolina.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Markus Wine Co 2019 Joey Insieme White (Lodi)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A mustard-yellow shade in the glass, this skin-fermented, solera-style orange wine shows ripe melon, fresh tangerine and apple-juice aromas on the nose. The texture is very grippy on the sip, where apple and orange-peel flavors meet with a slight tonic element, proving rather clean.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: The Lion For Real Skin Fermented
Name: Folktale NV The Lion For Real Skin Fermented White (Monterey County)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This unique blend is 49% Viognier, 41% Roussanne and 10% Riesling. Ripe peach and honeysuckle aromas are out front. Lightly sweet-seeming stone fruit and pear flavors follow, with enough acidity to tie it all together.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Brian Carter 2019 Oriana White (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sémillon makes up 61% of this wine, with the rest Sauvignon Blanc (21%) and Viognier. Aromas of ripe peach, fig and flower are followed by medium-bodied flavors. It displays the tartness of the vintage. Stone fruit flavors linger on the finish                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Succession 2019 Our Evolution White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: White stone-fruit and yellow spring-flower aromas shape the alluring nose. On the vibrant palate, racy acidity accompanies yellow apple, lemon zest and a tangy saline note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gambino 2018 Tifeo  (Etna)

Description: A blend of Carricante and Catarratto, this has aromas of yellow spring flower and white stone fruit. Lean and linear, the racy palate offers juicy Meyer lemon and yellow apple alongside crisp acidity. It closes on a hint of saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Statella 2019  Etna

Description: Delicate aromas of spring blossom and green melon mingle with a whiff of Mediterranean herb on this blend of 80% Carricante and 20% Catarratto. On the lean, linear palate, racy acidity accompanies ripe pear, hazelnut and tangy saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Antichi Vinai 1877 2019 Pietralava  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of graphite, yellow spring flower and white stone fruit waft out of the glass. A blend of Insolia, Grillo and Zibibbo, the lean linear palate features Meyer lemon, yellow apple and bitter almond alongside brisk acidity. A hint of saline marks the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cusumano 2018 Salealto Tenuta Ficuzza White (Sicilia)

Description: Combining 70% Muscadelle and 30% Sauvignon Blanc, without the addition of any oak, this white is light, floral and fruity, with a simple approachability.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Nichelini Family Winery 2019 Roman Press White (Napa Valley)

Description: White spring-flower and white stone-fruit aromas lead the way along a whiff of botanical herb. On the lean, vibrant palate, racy acidity accompanies mature yellow apple and Meyer lemon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nicosia 2019 Monte San Nicolò  (Etna)

Description: Made with 90% Catarratto and 10% Viogner, this has pronounced aromas of apricot and yellow peach. The aromas carry over to the tangy, savory palate along with candied lemon drop and a hint of saline. Bright acidity keeps it refreshing.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cottanera 2019 Barbazzale  (Etna)

Description: The shy nose doesn't give much away at first but eventually reveals subtle whiffs of mature stone fruit and hazelnut. On the lean palate, tangy acidity accompanies suggestions of mature yellow-apple skin, dried Mediterranean herb and tart lemon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Firriato 2017 Cavanera Ripa di Scorciavacca  (Etna)

Description: A blend of Grillo and Chardonnay, this has aromas of citrus and white spring blossom. The tangy palate offers Meyer lemon and a the barest hint of ginger alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gergenti 2019 White (Sicilia)

Description: Hints of fresh herb and lemon characterize this pert, subtle white blend. It's medium-sweet on the palate with a honeyed sweetness that clings on the palate. Sunny lemon candy acidity offers balance. Best young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Karl Josef 2018 Piesporter Michelsberg White (Mosel)

Description: Blending equal parts Marsanne, Viognier and Chardonnay, this hearty white is given 12 months in new French oak. It tastes of caramel, brioche and sweet apricot, with a finish that is beginning to show its age.                      Virginie Boone
Name: The Hidden Gallery 2016 Blanc Caché Stagecoach Vineyard White (Napa Valley)

Description: Markedly tropical compared with this bottling's Kabinett version, this is a juicy, fruit-forward blend of workhorse German grapes like Faberrebe, Silvaner, Bacchus, Kerner and Huxelrebe. It's sweet in style with a slightly nectar-like unctuousness but balanced by tangerine acidity. Enjoy young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Leonard Kreusch 2018 Weinkellerei Kreusch Spätlese White (Rheinhessen)

Description: A smoky nose leads to a palate of sweet pastry, lemon and grapefruit in this medium-sweet blend of Müller-Thurgau and Riesling. It's an easy-drinking, approachable sip with pert lemony acidity. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Leonard Kreusch 2018 Piesporter Michelsberg White (Mosel)

Description: Juicy apple, pear and peach flavors mark this medium-sweet blend of Bacchus and Silvaner grapes. It's not a complex wine but offers straightforward, juicy fruit flavors with just a touch of earthen minerality. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Leonard Kreusch 2018 Weinkellerei Kreusch Kabinett White (Rheinhessen)

Description: Tropical notes of pineapple and guava have a preserved tone in this candied white blend. It's a straightforward, fruity sip that finishes with a slightly treacly sweetness. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Leonard Kreusch 2018 Weinkellerei Kreusch Auslese White (Rheinhessen)

Description: On the nose of this wine, subtle notions of barley sugar and candied orange peel promise richness. The palate comes with concentrated but restrained sweetness that settles like balm on the tongue. Yes, this wine is rich but it lays itself down like a feather, providing warmth, smoothness and a gentle, medium sweetness that speaks of barley sugar, subtle sultana and vivid freshness. The balance reflects a most original expression of Alsace. It's a wine to take time over. Drink by 2045.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2015 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru White (Alsace)

Description: Smoke and golden sultana notions make for an unusual but inviting nose on this wine. These aromas are joined by resinous, honeyed richness that also informs the concentrated palate. There is something ethereal about the flavors, with their beeswax and citrus-rind lift that is anchored in textured richness. Powerful and incisive, the wine has a balm-like feel. Despite its dryness, it has an edge of caramel and a finish of dried lemon zest. Monumental.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2015 Mambourg Grand Cru White (Alsace)

Description: Mellow, rich notes of baked pear on this wine's nose come with sultana richness and an edge of honey. The medium-sweet palate turns the volume up on every flavor. Ripeness, roundness and a honeyed, slightly bitter edge give the wine contour. The smooth texture is wondrous. This wine is warm, round and rich, but oh so balanced. Drink by 2045.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2015 Schoenenbourg Grand Cru White (Alsace)

Description: Aromas of citrus and Mediterranean brush waft out of the glass on the delicious, linear white. Racy and elegant, the mouthwatering palate doles out juicy Meyer lemon, Bartlett pear and tangy mineral before a crisp, clean finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Generazione Alessandro 2018 Trainara  (Etna)

Description: This is a barrel-fermented blend of Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc made by Steve Matthiasson for the winery. Aged 10 months in French oak, 30% of it new, it is sublime and racy, tasting of candied lemon and exotic feijoas, with lasting freshness and complexity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ashes & Diamonds 2017 Blanc No 3 White (Napa Valley)

Description: Aromas of fragrant spring flower and white stone fruit with a delicate whiff of honey lift out of the glass. On the racy palate, vibrant acidity lends youthful tension to green melon, ginger and white pepper before a saline finish. Drink now, or hold for even more complexity. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2018 Nozze d'Oro White (Sicilia)

Description: Cedar, citrus and botanical herb aromas shape the alluring nose. On the elegantly structured palate, vibrant acidity frames golden apple, lemon drop candy and a hint of butterscotch. It closes on a slightly honeyed mineral note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2018 Santo Spirito  (Etna)

Description: As production ramps up, quality remains consistently high in this proprietary blend of cofermented Muscat, Riesling and Gewürztraminer. Spicy, penetrating aromas of pear blossoms, ginger and kumquat lead into a lively palate with citrus skin flavor, a dash of sea salt and drying minerality. It's a well-balanced, unique white wine with splendid food pairing options.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Ovum 2019 Big Salt White (Oregon)

Description: Elegant and savory, this racy white opens with delicate scents of yellow wildflowers, white stone fruit and Mediterranean scrub and a whiff of honey. It's vibrant and focused, delivering yellow apple, ripe pear, lemon zest and a mineral note of saline that lends depth. A hazelnut note lingers on the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Calcaneus 2019 Ginestra  (Etna)

Description: Vivid notes of Damask rose strike first on this wine's nose, taking over on the aromatic front. The palate rounds out the rose notes with mellow sweetness on a textured, generous palate grounded in ripe pear, with a bright vein of freshness. A medium-sweet finish is dominated by the balanced, sonorous pear note.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Sick-Dreyer 2018 Quatre/4 Kaefferkopf Grand Cru White (Alsace)

Description: The wine takes its name (Vin de Lune, moon wine) from the overnight harvesting of the grapes to keep freshness. The result, in this mature wine, is a fine equilibrium between yellow fruits and delicious spice and acidity. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2016 Clos Triguedina Vin de Lune Viognier-Chardonnay (Comté Tolosan)

Description: Hints of yeast on the nose of this wine lead onto a creamy, elegant palate where freshness, litheness and tiny bubbles unite against a yeasty backdrop. They come together nicely, a picture of creaminess, slight apple freshness and subtle depth.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam NV Emotion Brut White (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Racy and loaded with mineral tension, this elegant white opens with delicate aromas suggesting broom, pear and Mediterranean scrub. On the savory palate, crisp acidity and saline notes accompany yellow apple, Meyer lemon and a hint of honeyed almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Girolamo Russo 2019 Nerina  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of toasted hazelnut, yellow apple and botanical herb form the delicate nose along with the barest whiff of chamomile. Racy and ethereally elegant, the linear palate offers yellow pear, Meyer lemon and saline alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Benanti 2018 Contrada Cavaliere  (Etna)

Description: Pretty aromas of white spring flowers and white stone fruit steal the show on this tangy white. The savory palate doles out creamy white peach, ripe Bartlett pear and a hint of grapefruit before white almond and fennel seed signal the close. Crisp acidity keeps it fresh.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2019 Regaleali White (Sicilia)

Description: A blend of Carricante and Catarratto, this has energizing aromas of citrus, wild herb and green melon. Fresh and elegant, the focused, polished palate features Bartlett pear, white peach and Meyer lemon. It closes on notes of white almond and a hint of saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Firriato 2019 Le Sabbie dell'Etna  (Etna)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: A blend of both Manseng grapes along with the rare Petit Courbu, this wine is perfumed, ripe, full of a fine mix of yellow fruits, apples that are cut with a squeeze of lemon. A balanced, lightly spicy wine, this is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Capmartin 2019 Agrumes & Caetera  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)

Description: Delicate scents evoking Mediterranean scrub and citrus with the barest whiff of kerosene shape the subtle nose. On the linear palate, racy acidity accompanies honey and Meyer lemon before a saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Benanti 2016 Pietra Marina  (Etna)

Description: Floral aromas of broom, Mediterranean brush and white stone fruit emerge from the glass. Tangy and vibrant, the linear palate offers yellow apple, Meyer lemon and a savory mineral note suggesting saline alongside racy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Benanti 2019  Etna

Description: Floral aromas of broom, Mediterranean brush and white stone fruit emerge from the glass. Tangy and vibrant, the linear palate offers yellow apple, Meyer lemon and a savory mineral note suggesting saline alongside racy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Benanti 2019  Etna

Description: A blend of Grillo and Inzolia, this fragrant white opens with aromas of grapefruit and herbs along with a whiff of chamomile. The aromas follow through to the crisp, savory palate along with notes of tropical fruit and saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Baglio del Cristo di Campobello 2019 Adenzia White (Sicilia)

Description: Delicately scented, this has aromas of yellow spring wildflower and white stone fruit. Light bodied and racy, the palate offers Meyer lemon, yellow apple and saline alongside crisp acidity that lends tension.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cusumano 2019 Alta Mora  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of wisteria, citrus and Mediterranean herb almost leap from the glass on this fragrant white. Crisp and savory, the vibrant palate features ripe apricot, pear, white grapefruit and tangy saline notes.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Donnafugata 2019 Anthilia White (Sicilia)

Description: A blend of organically farmed Carricante and Catarratto, this elegant, racy white has aromas of white spring flower, white stone fruit and citrus. The vibrant palate reflects the nose, offering white grapefruit, yellow apple and a hint of bitter almond before a saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nicosia 2019 Fondo Filara  (Etna)

Description: Baked apple and tart pome-fruit aromas start the nose on this atypical blend of 34% Chardonnay, 33% Chenin Blanc and 33% Malvasia Bianca. Dried citrus, seared apples and light cashew flavors play on the intriguing if slightly confusing palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Saint K 2019 Cellular White (California)

Description: Aromas of apple, citrus and Mediterranean herb follow over to the tangy palate along with hints of white almond and fennel. A saline note marks the close, while crisp acidity keeps it racy and balanced.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nicosia 2019 Vulkà Bianco  (Etna)

Description: This white blend offers bright aromas of citrus blossoms, tangerine and juiced yellow plums on the nose, with a whiff of freshly picked spearmint chiming in. The juicy palate is driven by flavors of crushed stone, lemon and stone fruit, with a white-tea texture lending grip.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Valentina Passalacqua 2018 Terra Minuta White (Puglia)

Description: Fresh and savory, this tangy white has inviting aromas of white grapefruit and yellow stone fruit. On the refreshing palate, vibrant acidity accompanies juicy apricot, tangerine and lemon drop candy before a tangy close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Planeta 2019 La Segreta White (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of yellow stone fruit, citrus and Mediterranean herb leap out of the glass on this fragrant white. Made with 70% Insolia and 30% Chardonnay, the palate is more restrained but reflects the nose, offering ripe apricot, grapefruit and a suggestion of almond alongside bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cusumano 2019 Tenuta Ficuzza Angimbè White (Sicilia)

Description: Delicate aromas evoking honey, yellow apple and hazelnut mingle with whiffs of citrus. The linear palate is rather lean, suggesting Meyer lemon and saline alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Barone di Villagrande 2017 Superiore Contrada Villagrande  (Etna)

Description: This is an estate-grown white blending 45% Sauvignon Blanc, 40% Chardonnay and 15% Malvasia. Together they form a robust, succulent and fleshy core of tropical flavor, herb and earthy character, that is quite creamy and lush on the palate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Flora Springs 2019 Soliloquy White (Napa Valley)

Description: A tinge of pink in the color and distinctive chalk and peach-skin aromas lead to dry and fairly subtle flavors of minerals, peaches and apricots in this earthy and medium-bodied wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cline 2019 Farmhouse White (California)

Description: Deeply hued yellow-gold, this has aromas of cedar, Mediterranean herb and citrus. The palate is rather shy, offering suggestions of yellow apple skin and saline before closing on a hint of coffee.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Donnafugata 2017 Sul Vulcano  (Etna)

Description: Driven by aromas of crushed stone, papaya and yellow plum, this white blend is textural and enticing on the palate. Flavors of zesty lemon and plum skin meld with a slightly tropical undertone, with a gentle white-tea note adding nuance.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Amastuola 2019 Bianco Organic White (Salento)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Ripe pear and hay aromas introduce the palate where yellow apple, green pear and lime are laced in sunny acidity. A blend of Vermentino and Viognier, this offers a pleasing mix of brightness against rounded ripe fruit flavors.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Ferraton Père et Fils 2019 La Tournée White (Vin de France)

Description: Aromas of ripe stone fruit, honeycomb wax and citrus blossoms carry the boisterous nose. It's juicy and rounded on the palate, with persistent peach and plum flavors alongside an explosion of white blossoms. There's a taut texture that helps hone it all, making this an enjoyable large-format offering.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Valentina Passalacqua NV Sovracchiaro Bianco White (Puglia)

Description: Citrus, Mediterranean herb and broom aromas mingle together in the glass. On the light-bodied palate, crisp acidity accompanies Meyer lemon and saline notes.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Al-Cantàra 2019 Occhi di Ciumi  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of Spanish broom, wood shop and honey slowly take shape in the glass. The palate isn't very expressive but evokes the same honeyed note as the nose alongside hints toasted hazelnut, saline and a suggestion of lemon rind. It lacks fruit richness.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nicosia 2016 Contrada Monte Gorna  (Etna)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: From Winemaker Honorine Pain (nickname Ono), this is full and rich in style in a mix of almond, quince and yellow fruit flavors. The wine's acidity gets lost along the way, but the richness is a fine compensation. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: La Petite Métairie 2018 #ONO Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Vin de France)

Description: Rich and fruity, this blend of Chardonnay and Vermentino has a smooth, ripe texture that contrasts with the touches of citrus and crisp minerality. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2019 Domaine Vetriccie White (Ile de Beauté)
Winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

Description: This is a big, bold and even somewhat tannic wine that brings out strong citrus, almond and mineral flavors. A grippy texture and assertive acidity make it dry in mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: San Rucci 2019 Benvenuta White (California)

Description: This is a softly textured wine, with flavors of ripe cantaloupe, perfumed acidity and an attractive light touch of texture. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: DFJ Vinhos 2019 DFJ Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)

Description: Here's a fun, simple white that offers pear and citrus aromas that follow over to the tangy palate. Bright acidity keeps it lively, and a note evoking sea salt marks the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Valle dell'Acate 2019 Bellifolli White (Sicilia)

Description: A blend of Sauvignon, Chardonnay and Fiano, this straightforward white offers a mix of cut grass, papaya and stone aromas and flavors. Mild acidity gives just enough lift, with a slick of wet stone and citrus marking the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Amastuola 2019 Calaprice Organic White (Puglia)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A light, bright and herbal wine, this has green asparagus and citrus flavors. Acidity sears through the fruitiness, giving freshness and a crisp, vibrant character. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Cèdre 2019 Blandine le Blanc White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This is a soft, fruity blend of Chardonnay and Vermentino. It has a smooth, apple purée texture that has a hint of spice and pepper from the alcohol. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2019 Terra Santa White (Ile de Beauté)
Winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A light-hearted blend of Ugni Blanc and Colombard, this is a fruity, crisp wine. With fresh acidity, tangy lemon and currant crispness, the wine is just right for summer refreshment. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2018 Pigmentum Ugni Blanc-Colombard (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This blend of organically grown Chardonnay, Trebbiano, Fiano and Falanghina offers aromas of ripe yellow apple, plum, dried apricot and hay on the nose. The palate is rich in fresh and dried fruit tones, but utterly dry, with a warming sensation on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Casa Marrone 2018 Appassimento Bianco White (Puglia)

Description: A blend of Chardonnay and Sauvignon, this white offers aromas of walnut skin and citrus oil on the nose. It's tangy in citrus and white-plum flavors on the palate, ending briskly and with a slightly tannic tang.                      Alexander Peartree
