Name: Apollonio 2017 Mani del Sud White (Salice Salentino)

Description: A blend of Chardonnay and Sauvignon, this white offers aromas of walnut skin and citrus oil on the nose. It's tangy in citrus and white-plum flavors on the palate, ending briskly and with a slightly tannic tang.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Apollonio 2017 Mani del Sud White (Salice Salentino)

Description: Bland white fruit aromas exhibit a white mushroom character, while this feels round but flat. Dry apple flavors are dull at first, then slightly bitter.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Tricky Rabbit 2019 Reserva White (Maule Valley)

Description: One of Friuli's most iconic wines, this racy, elegant white opens with enticing scents of white spring flowers, orchard fruit, citrus and wet stone. Savory and vibrant, the palate boasts intriguing energy and tension, delivering ripe pear, peach, nectarine and lemon drop candy alongside a mineral vein and crisp acidity. Drink through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Jermann 2018 Vintage Tunina White (Venezia Giulia)

Description: Made with Pinot Grigio, Sauvignon and Ribolla Gialla, this delicious white has enticing scents of spring blossoms and white stone fruit with citrusy notes. Rounded, full bodied and enveloping, the savory palate doles out creamy white peach, mature apple and grapefruit alongside crushed herb and ginger notes set against fresh acidity. A saline note energizes the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Raccaro 2018 Bianco White (Collio)

Description: Made with 80% Carricante, 10% Catarratto and 10% Minnella, this elegant white has aromas of white stone fruit, yellow spring flowers and Mediterranean scrub. On the focused, savory palate, vibrant acidity supports ripe pear, citrus, graphite and saline before a toasted almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Biondi 2018 Pianta Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Delicately scented, this has soft aromas of white spring flowers, white stone fruit and botanical herb. Vibrant and elegant, the racy palate offers peach, Meyer lemon and ripe pear alongside crisp acidity before a tangy mineral close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Zuani 2018 Vigne White (Collio)

Description: Spring blossom, white stone fruit and Mediterranean scrub aromas form the delicate, enticing nose. On the racy palate, crisp acidity accompanies ripe pear, apple and lemon drop candy, while a briny note backs up the already energized finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Palmento Costanzo 2019 Mofete  (Etna)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly wound aromas of lemon and kumquat juice meet with a ripe pear aroma on the nose of this bottling. There is a fun zip to the sip, where ripe pear, red-apple and melon aromas are wrapped in a chalky, ashy frame.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thacher 2018 Approximately Perfect White (Paso Robles)

Description: Ripe pear notes have an overtone of candied lime on the nose of this wine. The palate brims with fruit and freshness. This blend brings together the generosity, roundness and texture of Pinot Gris with the soaring vigor of Riesling, showing why these two varieties complement each other so well. The finish is dry and appetizing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2019 Black Tie by Pfaff White (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: A flinty whiff of reduction obscures the nose on this wine. The palate comes in with slight lemon freshness and nutty-textured, chalky brightness. Lovely balance fills the palate, still with those appetizing, flinty edges. Final freshness gives the wine its joyful fillip.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2018 Zind White (Alsace)

Description: Graphite, yellow apple and freshly baked bread aromas escape the glass. On the medium-bodied, elegantly structured palate, vibrant acidity accompanies yellow peach, lemon drop candy and grapefruit before a toasted almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ronco dei Tassi 2018 Fosarin Bianco White (Collio)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: The Zinfandel specialist offers a brilliant white wine from its estate here, 100% Greco—an Italian grape variety not officially recognized in the United States, thus not listed on the label. A tribute to the matriarch of the Biale family, it is crisp and sleek in slate, grippy tangerine and pomelo.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Biale 2019 Clementina White (Oak Knoll District)

Description: A blend of Friulano, Chardonnay, Sauvignon and Ribolla Gialla, this has subtle aromas of pressed yellow field flowers, oak, dried tropical fruit and cedar. It was aged for two years in Slavonian oak barrels, and the palate offers dried yellow peach, mature yellow apple, saline and a dollop of vanilla alongside fresh acidity. It closes on a roasted coffee bean note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Primosic 2015 Klin Bianco White (Collio)

Description: Made with Friulano, Chardonnay, Malvasia and Sauvignon, this has aromas of hazelnut and summer orchard fruit with whiffs of cedar. On the linear, medium-bodied palate, fresh acidity accompanies mature Golden Delicious apple, Bartlett pear and grapefruit before closing on a bitter almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ronco Blanchis 2017 Blanc de Blanchis Riserva White (Collio)

Description: Aromas of French oak, vanilla, toast and white orchard fruit waft out of the glass. On the elegant palate, fresh acidity lifts ripe yellow apple, peach and butterscotch before a café au lait finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Russiz Superiore 2016 Col Disôre White (Collio)

Description: Slightly sour lemon-peel aromas play against the more ripe tone of pear flesh and honeydew on the nose of this Chardonnay-led blend. There's a toasty quality to the sip, where clean and rich flavors of lemon, baked apple and sea salt carry long into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tooth & Nail 2018 Fragrant Snare White (California)

Description: Aromas of French oak, toast and yellow apple are front and center. Made predominantly with Chardonnay and aged in oak barrels, it has a smooth, elegant palate offering ripe pear, white peach, vanilla and butterscotch alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Jermann 2018 Where Dreams Have No End White (Venezia Giulia)

Description: A blend of Friulano, Malvasia and Ribolla Gialla, this opens with aromas of acacia flower, ripe yellow stone fruit, citrus zest and hazelnut. Fermented in large casks, the wine has a full-bodied palate offering butterscotch, coconut, ripe yellow apple and a honeyed almond note. This is a complex white made to accompany first and second courses as opposed to a fresh aperitivo.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gradis'ciutta 2016 Riserva White (Collio)

Description: Subtle aromas evoking freshly baked bread, ripe tropical fruit, citrus zest and toasted nut shape the delicate nose. On the rounded, medium-bodied palate, notes of lemon drop candy and bitter almond accent a core of ripe yellow apple and dried grapefruit slice.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gradis'ciutta 2017 Bratinis Bianco White (Collio)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: An orange wine, this was produced from a blend of three-quarters Riesling and one-quarter split between Vermentino and Viognier, all fermented on the skins. Scents of orange blossoms abound, and the flavors are exceptionally fresh and clean. The sharp acids emphasize flavors of citrus flesh and rind, and there are noticeable tannins, firming up the finish. Drink now and into 2022.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Troon 2019 Kubli Bench Amber White (Applegate Valley)

Description: A blend of Friulano and Ribolla Gialla, this has aromas of French oak, spring blossoms and ripe yellow apple. On the medium-bodied palate, crisp acidity supports white grapefruit, mature pear and bitter almond before a butterscotch close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Livon 2019 Solarco Bianco White (Collio)

Description: This rich, almost thick wine exudes strong buttery, toasty aromas and flavors and full body. It has a mouthcoating density that nicely wraps up almond, poached pear and sawn oak nuances.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Peltier 2018 Preeminence White (Lodi)

Description: Made with 90% Turbiana and 10% Chardonnay, this has aromas of acacia, toasted nut and yellow apple. The flavors follow over to the vibrant palate along with peach, lemon drop candy and bitter almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pratello 2019 90+10  (Lugana)

Description: A blend of Fiano and Greco fermented and aged in tonneau, this has aromas of beeswax, acacia flower and honey. The aromas follow over to the vibrant, linear palate along with yellow apple, oak-driven spice and toasted almond before a saline finish. Bright acidity keeps it fresh.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2018 Campanaro Bianco White (Irpinia)

Description: A blend of Fiano and Greco fermented and aged in tonneau, this has aromas of beeswax, acacia flower and honey. The aromas follow over to the vibrant, linear palate along with yellow apple, oak-driven spice and toasted almond before a saline finish. Bright acidity keeps it fresh.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2018 Campanaro Bianco White (Irpinia)

Description: A blend of equal parts Friulano, Chardonnay, Sauvignon and Pinot Grigio, this has aromas of French oak, vanilla and white and yellow stone fruit. Lean and racy, the firm palate offers hazelnut, mature yellow apple skin and butterscotch alongside bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Zuani 2017 Riserva White (Collio)

Description: Aromas of yellow stone fruit, thyme and graphite lead the nose. Reflecting the aromas, the rounded palate offers dried apricot, saline and a bread crust note alongside soft acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Angoris 2017 Locatelli Riserva Bianco White (Collio)

Description: A blend of 60% Greco and 40% Malvasia, this savory white offers tones of creamy white bean, blanched almond and white blossoms on the nose. It has an almost fino Sherry quality to the palate, showing more tones of blanched nuts alongside savory yeast and a zippy line of lemon. This would sing alongside a simple plate of shellfish cooked in white wine and topped with fresh herbs.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Botromagno 2019 White (Gravina)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Crisp and citrusy, this medium-bodied wine is mostly a blend of Vermentino and Grenache Blanc. It leads with good acidity and bright lemon, lime and grapefruit notes. The texture is tangy and palate cleansing.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Andis 2019 Painted Fields Cuvée Blanc White (Sierra Foothills)

Description: This opens with aromas of coconut, French oak and grapefruit. The aromas follow over to the palate along with butterscotch, saline and bitter almond set against firm acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Rajade 2016 Caprizi Riserva White (Collio)

Description: Subtle aromas of spring blossoms and beeswax form the delicate nose. On the racy, linear palate, firm acidity accompanies yellow apple, lemon and saline before a bitter almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Biondi 2018 Outis Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of spring blossoms and pear form the delicate nose, while the fresh, enjoyable palate offers yellow apple and white peach. A bitter almond note signals the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gianni Tessari 2019  Soave

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Blanc and Pinot Meunier is very fruity and friendly, offering generous peach and pear flavors, a full body and a smooth texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Imagery 2018 White Burgundy White (North Coast)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This blend of Pampanuto and Bombino Bianco offers bright aromas of candied lemon blossoms and freshly cut Gala apple, with a bit of melon richness filling it out. Medium in weight, the palate is well balanced in flavors of citrus, melon and apple, while bright acidity keeps it feeling fresh and crisp.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Crifo 2019 Bianco White (Castel del Monte)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There is a pleasant tightness to the nose of this obscure blend of Viognier, Gewürztraminer and Muscat Canelli, with hints of crushed rock as well as lemon-pith aromas. The palate is quite ripe, with loads of pear and apples and a slight smoke tone.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Nectar Of The Dogs 2017 3 Dogs White (Santa Barbara County)

Description: A blend of Bombino Bianco and Chardonnay, this white offers crisp aromas of apple and citrus, with hints of smoke and stone chiming in. The palate is rounded out by a pleasing melon tone, with lemon peel and walnut skin flavors giving a slightly bitter edge.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Villa Schinosa 2018 Pezza del Vado Bianco White (Puglia)

Description: This has subtle aromas suggesting beeswax and broom. It's brisk and light bodied, offering acacia honey, hazelnut and bitter yellow apple skin alongside firm acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Federico Curtaz 2017 Ca Gamma  (Etna)

Description: This easy-going, seemingly sweet wine combines floral and fruity notes on a soft, broad texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Apothic 2018 White (California)

Description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals whiffs of spring flowers and the barest hint of tropical fruit. On the extremely simple, light-bodied palate, fresh acidity accompanies suggestions of peach and bitter almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tinazzi 2019 Tarciso  (Lugana)

Description: This is a consistently beautiful and beguiling white wine, a blend of Tocai Friulano, Ribolla Gialla and Chardonnay, the latter from Hyde Vineyards. Structured, mineral-driven and explosive in flavors of lemon zest, green apple and wet stone, it is a wine well worth stocking.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Massican 2019 Annia White (Napa Valley)

Description: A rare, beautifully conceived blend of Napa Valley Pinot Bianco and Sonoma County Greco, Gemina is refreshing and hugely memorable in crunchy fruit and freshness. Slatey, with a taste of the ocean, it evolves in the glass to impart a fleshy lushness of fig.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Massican 2019 Gemina White (California)

Description: One sniff of this honey-hued Viognier, Gewürztraminer, Muscat and Riesling blend, which receives 60 days on skins, practically knocks you off your chair, such is the intensity of its perfume. Grapefruit, pineapple, ginger, honey, wet hay, spice and a slight funk (terroirs-derived, not winemaking) lead to a palate that is somewhat less bombastic. Evoking a warm spring day, honey and river stones are buttoned by a savory, earthy, skinsy grip at the finish. This is definitely in the natural camp, but there's an unforced beauty to the stripped back style.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Millton 2018 Libiamo Field Blend White (Gisborne)

Description: Winemaker: Miles Mossop. Ripe apple flesh, white melon rind, lime pith and a touch of rambutan form the nose of this clean, attractive white. A blend of 65% Chenin Blanc, 25% Clairette Blanche and 10% Grenache Blanc, hints of lanolin and just-dried grass add depth and interest, with a waxy characteristic that's pleasantly attractive. The palate is medium in weight and strikes a superb balance between ripe fruit tones and bright, vibrant acidity, walking a masterful tightrope between the two. The finish shows notes of yellow apple, firm pear, citrus pith and waxy melon rind that hang around nicely.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Miles Mossop 2018 Cape Winemakers Guild Saskia-Jo White (Swartland)

Description: A touch of reduction on the nose leaves a smoky allure. It continues with flinty savor on the rich, rounded and generous palate where notions of red apple, dried lemon peel, orange pith and yeast appear with concentration and expressiveness. It's lovely now but certain to evolve. Drink 2025–2045.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wieninger 2018 Ried Ulm Nussberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: An ethereal note of dried hayflower and dried citrus peel hits the nose immediately with its lift, promising ripeness and aroma. The palate is compact, wonderfully textured with a kind of intense citrus pith and very concentrated. Yes, there is this ripeness, but also that etheral, lifted freshness of dried lemon peel. This cries out for food with its layers, freshness and intensity.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hajszan Neumann 2018 Nussberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: Made with 75% Inzolia and 25% Sauvignon Tasca, a unique clone of Sauvignon grown at the Regaleali estate, this is one of Sicily's top whites, and it shows good aging potential. It opens with aromas of spring blossom, white stone fruit and citrus along with a whiff of Mediterranean scrub. On the elegant palate, fresh acidity lifts honeydew, creamy white peach and Meyer lemon, while a tangy saline note lends mineral tension. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2017 Tenuta Regaleali Nozze d'Oro White (Sicilia)

Description: Brown butter and mellow notes of baked apple come with a creamy hazelnut edge on the rich, open nose. The palate is equally generous and totally rounded with more of those creamy, mellow apple and butter notes. Countering this richness and pulling all into focus is a pervasive lemon oil freshness. The apple notes abound from start to long, concentrated, dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Arndorfer 2017 Leidenschaft White (Niederösterreich)

Description: This late-harvest wine carries aromas of pear and acacia flower, with flavors of Bartlett pear, apricot and dried rosemary. It has nice weight on the midpalate and the finish is pleasantly sweet without being too cloying.                      Jeff Jenssen
Name: Royal Tokaji 2017 Late Harvest  (Tokaji)

Description: This organic white blend (a combo of Chardonnay, Riesling, Sauvignon, Pinot Gris and Gewürztraminer) is part of Huia's every day range, but it's every bit as good as many of its own label wines. It's pale lemon in hue, with a perfume of fresh peach, pineapple, orange, ginger and heady florals like jasmine and hibiscus billowing from the glass. Soft mineral nuances add complexity. The palate takes it up a notch: dry, textural, laced with bright, prickly acidity and a finish like candied ginger. Expressive of both place and varietals, all at a bargain price.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Hunky Dory 2019 Tangle White (Marlborough)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Though from the Old World, Frenchmen-turned-Californians Arnaud and Guillaume Fabre buck tradition with this blend of 64% Chardonnay and 36% Sauvignon Blanc, aged in 30% new French oak. The result is aromas of crushed red apple, peach and green chile followed by a palate that's both round with guava and apple and yet brisk with grass, lime pith and a cement-like grip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Benom 2019 Contrast Chardonnay-Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Description: Pink-hued and funky, this skin-contact orange wine brims with clementine and orange peel notes on the nose, supported by an overtone of honeysuckle. The light palate has a texture reminiscent of citrus pith and tingles with freshness, while clementine and white pepper notes are highlighted by the bone-dry nature. It is compelling and wonderfully light.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Biokult 2019 Naken Made With Organic Grapes White (Burgenland)

Description: Lemon notes on the nose come with a richer insinuation of ripe orange peel. The palate is fresh and bright, brimming with notions of apple and orange, Mirabelle and lemon, pitched agains a zesty, pithy, lovely texture. The finish is dry and lipsmacking.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Ingrid Groiss 2019 Braitenpuechtorff Gemischter Satz White (Niederösterreich)

Description: The nose is a rich and vivid evocation of baked apple doused in melted butter. The palate then adds vivid notes of fresh, juicy apple and a salty, mouthwatering freshness that plays well with the mellow, textured midpalate. The finish is dry, vivid and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Arndorfer 2018 Gemischter Satz Terrassen 1958 White (Weinland Österreich)

Description: The fresh, Cox apple flesh notes on the nose are framed with hints of white blossom. The palate is concentrated and has a rich, waxy element but also vivid apple freshness. Above all it has serene, joyous balance and a dry apple-scented finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gebeshuber 2019 Querfeldein White (Thermenregion)

Description: White spring flower, summer orchard fruit and a whiff of citrus lead the nose. On the juicy, savory palate, a saline note underscores mature yellow apple, Bartlett pear and Meyer lemon before an almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Montevetrano 2017 Core White (Campania)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From organic grapes, this bottling shows tangy aromas of tangerine peel and lemon zest as well as stony granite and candied melon elements. The palate is zesty with Meyer lemon-peel flavors and a slightly nutty quality.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Maha 2017 Before Anyone Else White (Adelaida District)

Description: This light-straw-colored wine has a nose of apple tart and brambles. It is rich on the palate, with flavors of apple, pineapple and orange blossom, with a strong vein of minerality. There is a soft floral note on the smooth finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Yacoubian-Hobbs 2017 Dry White (Vayots Dzor)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh grapefruit and ripe apple make for a fresh and inviting nose on this blend of 36% Chardonnay, 32% Pinot Blanc and 32% Pinot Gris. Lime-pith and guava-peel flavors make for a briefly botanical twist to the palate before more tropical elements of mango emerge atop the chalky texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Barden 2018 Fonte White (Sta. Rita Hills)

Description: Aromas of beeswax and white stone fruit mingling with a whiff of oak-driven vanilla shape the nose. The palate offers mature yellow apple, lemon zest, saline and a hint of espresso together with crisp acidity and mineral-driven tension.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Fessina 2015 Il Musmeci Contrada Caselle Bianco  (Etna)

Description: A hint of blossom, fresh lemon and a note of sun-dried hay hover gently on the nose. The palate adds a yeasty vibe and slight texture to the dry, light body. Underneath it all a vein of freshness makes this very hard not to take a second sip. Dry, refreshing and moreish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Neumeister 2019 Gemischter Satz White (Steiermark)

Description: Lemon and a hint of honeysuckle play on the nose. The palate sweeps in with vivid freshness and lemony brightness, packaged in a light, dry, slender body that provides effortless refreshment.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kohl 2019 Gemischter Satz White (Weinviertel)

Appellation: Puget Sound, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc, Pinot Blanc and Pinot Gris offers aromas of musk, smoke, lime, apricot and green apple. The palate brings delightful, medium-bodied flavors, with green-like apple acidity piquing the interest. The acidity is the main driver.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Skagit Crest 2017 Estate Bottled Chuckanut White (Puget Sound)

Description: This well-aged, very mature and deliciously fortified wine is a tawny brown in color. Once its initially earthy aroma blows off, it offers rich butterscotch, toasted pecan and caramel flavors that are long lasting on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Toca Madera 2014 Dulce Vida White (Madera)

Description: Made with 90% Carricante and 10% Catarratto, this has delicate aromas of white spring flower, Mediterranean scrub and pear. On the rounded palate, tangy acidity lifts yellow apple, Meyer lemon, acacia honey and almond before a saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Palmento Costanzo 2018 Bianco di Sei  (Etna)

Description: Exotic fruit and lemon-zest aromas start this elegant white blend of Assyrtiko and Sauvignon Blanc. Sophisticated and balanced, with a fresh acidity, it offers tropical-fruit and citrus-peel flavors that unfold in vibrant layers.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2019 Amethystos Blanc White (Drama)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This generous and fragrant blend includes Viognier, Roussanne, Marsanne and Grenache Blanc. Floral and citrus aromas lead into a citrusy mix of Meyer lemon, orange and tangerine, with further hints of pineapple and papaya.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Quady North 2018 Pistoleta White (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Orange-blossom, guava and jasmine aromas make for a very floral entry to the nose of this white blend. It's bone dry on the palate, where grapefruit peel and a hint of tropical guava fruit make for an intriguing combination.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Larner 2017 Unconformity White (Ballard Canyon)

Description: This successful combination of Roditis and Sauvignon Blanc offers intense aromas of citrus, tropical fruit and flowers, with brisk but juicy white-fruit and citrus flavors. A savory finish gives the wine extra flair. This will be great with grilled fish and seafood.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Strofilia 2018 White (Peloponnese)

Description: From the slopes of Mount Athos, this Athiri-Assyrtiko blend offers a sultry nose of tropical fruit, lemon peel and dried herbs, along with bright and elegant flavors of citrus and spice. The wine has pronounced acidity and verve—an excellent go-to white with exotic appeal.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Tsantali 2018 Abaton Athiri-Assyrtiko White (Mount Athos)

Description: This wine offers structure, body and finesse, while remaining refined and refreshing. Flinty and grapefruit aromas follow with mouthwatering citrus, smoke and spice, and a long, savory finish.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Argyros 2018 Atlantis White (Greece)

Description: This white blend of Assyrtiko, Aidani and Athyri offers an aromatic start, with white flowers, resin and smoke leading into focused citrus and mineral flavors. Structured and pert, the wine should open up with additional age, but is refreshing and fun to drink now.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Acroterra 2017 White (Santorini)

Description: Lemon and lemon balm send aromatic freshness from the glass. The palate also shimmers with green notes reminiscent of moss, boxwood and blossom, all surrounded by lightness, slight spritz and lemony freshness. This is easy but oh so fresh and makes a cracking, light summer wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hugl-Wimmer 2019 Gemischter Satz by Martin White (Niederösterreich)

Description: Melony aromas are dulled by haystack and wheaty scents, while this Catalonian white feels full and generally well balanced. Lightly oxidized, leesy flavors of melon, white grapefruit and pineapple are not a common package, while this feels smooth, honeyed and creamy on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Abadia de Poblet 2016 White (Conca de Barberà)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This blend of Riesling and Gewürztraminer offers mild aromas of lime peel, white cherry and crushed stone. The palate is broad in a zesty, tart white-fruit flavor, with orange-laden acidity lifting it up. Tangy lemon peel lingers on the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Wagner 2018 Fathom 107 White (Seneca Lake)

Description: This Romanian wine is a blend of Chardonnay, Feteasca Regala, Sauvignon Blanc and Muscat Ottonel. It has aromas of honeydew and cantaloupe melons and citrus blossoms. In the mouth there are flavors of apple, pear, peach and melon, with a smooth finish.                      Jeff Jenssen
Name: Cramele Recas 2018 Solo Quinta White (Romania)

Description: This white wine is a blend of Chardonnay, Feteasca Regala, Sauvignon Blanc and Muscat Ottonel. It has aromas of cantaloupe melon and citrus blossom. In the mouth, it is balanced and smooth, with flavors of honeydew melon, apple, pear, and white peach.                      Jeff Jenssen
Name: Cramele Recas 2019 Wildflower Cuvée Blanc Reserva White (Recas)

Description: Yellow stone fruit and fragrant spring flower aromas lead the nose. Made with organically grown grapes, the tangy palate offers white grapefruit, apricot and tangerine drop candy alongside bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo di Santa Tresa 2018 Rina Ianca White (Sicilia)

Description: Made with grapes harvested from Assyrtiko vines that are over 200 years old, this wine balances acidity and smoke with spices and vanilla wrought from its subtle oak aging. Flavors of pert citrus and tropical fruit are refreshing and elegant.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Argyros 2017 Cuvée Monsignori White (Santorini)

Description: Made with grapes harvested from Assyrtiko vines that are over 200 years old, this wine balances acidity and smoke with spices and vanilla wrought from its subtle oak aging. Flavors of pert citrus and tropical fruit are refreshing and elegant.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Argyros 2017 Cuvée Monsignori White (Santorini)

Description: Melony white-fruit aromas are fairly generic but clean, while this blend of Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc is full to the point of being creamy. Woody aromas of oak grain and spiced apple finish smooth, simple and steady.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Príncipe de Viana 2018 Edición Blanca White (Navarra)

Description: This Romanian orange wine is actually more golden hued in the glass, with aromas of apple juice, vanilla, apple cider vinegar and rose petal. In the mouth, it is slightly tart on the midpalate, with flavors of apple cider, vanilla, peach and nectarine.                      Jeff Jenssen
Name: Cramele Recas 2019 Amber Natural Wine White (Romania)

Description: Oily white-fruit aromas are lightly oxidized and soft. This is 80% Garnacha Blanca, with the rest Macabeo, and it feels melony and a touch flat, as if it's entering its final days. Honey, green-banana and melon flavors are, like the rest of the wine, nice but flat.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Portal del Montsant 2017 Bruberry Blanc White (Montsant)

Description: A slight pink color comes from the fact that while this is mostly Garnacha Blanca, there is Merlot and Garnacha Tinta in the blend. Aromas of peach pit and melon lead to a full palate that hits with acidity before turning creamy. Grape-skin contact during fermentation not only lends color but has given this textural grab and mild bitterness on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Mas Igneus 2017 Renéixer White (Priorat)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: From vineyards in the western Loire, this blend of Chardonnay, Melon de Bourgogne and a tiny touch of Sauvignon Blanc is floral, softly ripe while also bright with acidity. Drink this attractive, light wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lieubeau 2019 La Fruitière Vignes Blanches White (Val de Loire)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: From vineyards in the western Loire, this blend of Chardonnay, Melon de Bourgogne and a tiny touch of Sauvignon Blanc is floral, softly ripe while also bright with acidity. Drink this attractive, light wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lieubeau 2019 La Fruitière Vignes Blanches White (Val de Loire)

Description: This pale gold-colored blend of Pinot Gris, Riesling and Chardonnay is on the closed, sulfured side. With time in the glass, the stone fruit, pineapple and somewhat soapy florals become more apparent. The palate offers lots of acidity and a creamy texture but both feel a little aggressive and lack cohesion.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Paddy Borthwick 2019 Paper Road CPR White (Wairarapa)

Appellation: Vin de Savoie, France Other, France
Description: A crisp blend of Chasselas, Chardonnay, Altesse and Jacquère, this is really an aperitif wine. Bright, fruity, buoyant and vivacious, it offers immediate appeal. Grapefruit, lime and a touch of honey bring out the delicious side of this wine. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Philippe Viallet 2018 Blanc White (Vin de Savoie)

Description: Enticing aromas of peach, apricot and white flowers start this elegant blend of Malagousia and Roditis. The palate offers zesty citrus-peel pluck but finishes long, with a wave of creamy apricot fruit—think perfect patio sip?and a great pairing for Indian or Chinese cuisine.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Kir-Yianni 2018 Paranga White (Macedonia)

Description: Lemon zest, flowers and herbs start the nose on this silky but brisk white. The wine has an overall easy-drinking quality but refinement as well, with complexity in its herbal backbone.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Avantis 2018 Mountrichas Family White (Evia)

Description: Smooth and rather soft in mouthfeel, this full-bodied wine shows pleasant, mild fruit flavors and a light touch of dried herbs.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Smith Devereux 2018 White (California)

Description: Oily, nutty aromas are low on fruit. This barrel-fermented white Rioja is full and chunky on the palate, while the flavor profile includes stalky but generic white fruits, raw oak and some bitterness. A plump finish is based mostly on barrel tannins.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Amaren 2016 Barrel Fermented White (Rioja)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Floral, yeasty aromas include a sweet note of cured ham. This blend of Chardonnay and Macabeo (Viura) is full and chunky, with honeyed white-fruit flavors. On the finish, waxy floral notes return and are backed by mild bitterness.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Borsao 2018 White (Campo de Borja)

Description: Quiet, chalky mineral aromas introduce flavors of white peach and juicy, fresh lemon on an easy, straight-forward palate. Neutral, light and severely tart, it ends on a zingy orange zest tone.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Carboy 2018 Blan.CO White (Grand Valley)

Description: Tropical-fruit aromas include notes of orange blossom and mango. This blend of Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc feels fresh and citrusy. Lime and lychee flavors finish with snappy tightness.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Vicente Gandia 2018 El Miracle 120 Aniversario Chardonnay-Sauvignon Blanc (Valencia)

Description: A stalky nose gets better with air but never smells fully clean or clear. This blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Viognier and Chardonnay is round and fleshy in feel, with melony flavors that turn slightly bitter on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Made with Organic Grapes Estate Bottled
Name: Inkarri 2018 Made with Organic Grapes Estate Bottled White (Mendoza)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Dark-tinted skin-contact wines are all the rage, but this gold-brown number is just O.K. Subdued peach and apricot aromas precede a palate with textural grip. Savory, salty flavors of dried stone fruits lose steam on a finish without much follow through or complexity.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Dominio de Punctum 2017 20,000 Leguas Amber Wine Skin Contact White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Mildly briny aromas of apple-carrot juice and pyrazines open this blend of 90% Airén and 10% Sauvignon Blanc. The palate is melony and plump at first, then flat. Bland papaya and melon flavors finish without much length or zest.                      Michael Schachner
Name: La Bodega de Pinoso 2017 Vergel White (Alicante)

Description: Mild apple and peach aromas are neither bad nor good, just simple and giving off a hint of pyrazines. A full, oily palate is almost viscous, while this tastes of melon and sugary stone fruits.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2018 Satinela Medium Sweet White (Rioja)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This 50-50 blend of Pinot Blanc and Pinot Gris seems impacted by some off-flavors. It's light and generic, with a weak, sour finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Ardiri 2018 Chehalem Gold White White (Willamette Valley)

Description: Lower alcohol levels and using grapes grown at high elevations is all the rage in Argentina, but sometimes the result is this: something sharp, prickly and pyranzinic. And odd blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and Grüner Veltliner, this smells feline and green, while the mouthfeel is citric and watery. Green flavors are borderline vegetal, while this is angular and tart on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Norton 2018 Altura White (Mendoza)

Description: This is a powerful blend of Gros Manseng, Petit Manseng and the rare Petit Courbu. Fermented in wood, it offers enticing apple and lightly oxidative flavors that are developing well. The fruit is still young so drink this wine from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2017 Cirque Nord Grande Cuvée  (Saint-Mont)

Description: Aromas of pear and exotic fruit form the nose on this lovely, refreshing white. Racy and linear, the savory palate features apple, Meyer lemon and tangy mineral alongside hints of pineapple and white almond. Vibrant acidity keeps it bright and lively.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ca' Rugate 2018 Monte Fiorentine  (Soave Classico)

Description: Aromas of pear and exotic fruit form the nose on this lovely, refreshing white. Racy and linear, the savory palate features apple, Meyer lemon and tangy mineral alongside hints of pineapple and white almond. Vibrant acidity keeps it bright and lively.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ca' Rugate 2018 Monte Fiorentine  (Soave Classico)

Description: This light-bodied wine tastes crisp and is absolutely refreshing. It holds back from complete ripeness, and the slightly restrained green apple and white peach flavors are mouthwatering.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Terra d'Oro 2019 Chenin Blanc-Viognier (Clarksburg)

Description: Delicate floral aromas of peach blossom lend elegance to an otherwise melony nose. This blend of Albariño, Loureiro and Caiño is typical of the Rosal subzone of Rías Baixas. Flavors of melon, green fruits and peppery herbs finish slightly bitter, with a note of grapefruit pith. Drink through 2021.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Quinta de Couselo 2018 Rosal White (Rías Baixas)

Description: Production keeps rising while the price stays the same and the quality is as good as ever. A blend of eight different white wine grapes, this wine is fragrant in citrus tones. Spunky is the word that best characterizes the crisp, fresh mix of peaches and lemons. It's a lovely mix, polished and ready for a wide variety of vegetarian and light seafood dishes.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Sokol Blosser NV Evolution Lucky No. 9 White (America)

Description: Enticing scents of white spring blossom, white stone fruit and botanical herb shape the delicate but inviting nose. The polished, linear palate offers juicy peach, lychee and hints of saline alongside tangy acidity. An almond note signals the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: I Campi 2019 Campo Vulcano  (Soave Classico)

Description: This savory white has aromas and flavors of acacia, yellow pear, lemon drop and almond. Tangy acidity underscores the palate, while a honeyed note marks the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Corte Adami 2018 Vigna della Corte  (Soave Superiore)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: Partially fermented in wood, this rich wine offers ripe fruit on the nose. The dry palate contrasts with its lemon and honey freshness that is instantly attractive. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2018 Vignobles Marie Maria Novel  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)

Description: Smoothness and freshness come together in this lightly wood-aged wine. Soft acidity and just the hint of a crisp lemon texture have been married perfectly into this perfumed and balanced wine. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2019 White (Tejo)

Description: A dusty note of lanolin rests atop a melony nose, while this blend of Viura and Malvasia is lively on the palate, with ringing acidity. Flavors of vanilla, oak spice and green melon finish with floral honey notes.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Leizaola 2018 Paloma De Sacramento White (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of hazelnut, yellow stone fruit and acacia waft out of the glass, along with a whiff of wild herb. It's crisp and linear, offering flavors of mature yellow pear, peach and a honeyed almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nardello 2018 Turbian  (Soave Classico)

Description: A blend of Pinot Gris, Riesling and Gewürztraminer, from the high elevation New South Wales region of Orange, this is a zippy, refreshing wine that commences with delicate aromas of lime, orange, pear and floral notes. As it warms, the fruit becomes more honeyed and pronounced. Racy acidity dominates a lightweight palate. You can see the influence of all three varieties, although the sum of their parts is less characterful than one would hope.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Gilbert 2019 Blanc White (Orange)

Description: This medium-bodied wine tastes quite ripe and fruity and feels rich on the palate. Banana, melon and kiwi flavors vie for attention, and they're nicely wrapped in a smooth texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Pine Ridge 2019 Chenin Blanc-Viognier (California)

Description: Although this wine is dry, it has a honeyed edge from its blend with Petit Manseng. Soft and smoothly textured, the wine has apple and pear fruits laced with tight citrus acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Bordenave 2017 Les Copains d'Abord  (Jurançon Sec)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: The two star white grapes of Gascony blended together give this lightly honeyed, off-dry wine. Late-harvest fruit brings richness while keeping plenty of freshness and acidity. This attractive wine is now ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Ménard 2018 Cuvée Prestige White (Côtes de Gascogne)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: This has a subdued nose that eventually offers whiffs of toasted nut, honey and hints of yellow apple. The aromas follow over to the palate along with a note of candied lemon drop and bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monte Tondo 2018 Casette Foscarin  (Soave Classico)

Description: Fermented and aged partly in barriques, this has aromas of French oak, cedar, coconut and vanilla. The vanilla follows over to the medium-bodied palate along with butterscotch and candied lemon drop before a bitter almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nardello 2017 Monte Zoppega  (Soave Classico)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This wine celebrates the abundance of grape varieties in southwestern France. An intriguing blend, it brings the honey of the Petit Manseng to the herbal character of Colombard. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2019 IO Planète Cépages White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: A blend of Gros and Petit Manseng with some rarer local varieties, this is a rich, dry wine. As often with this style, there is a hint of honey as well as a core of ripe white fruits and citrus. The wine is still young and will be better from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Bordenave 2018 Souvenirs d'Enfance  (Jurançon Sec)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely bright citrus aromas of lime and grapefruit meet with toast, chalk and dried grass on the nose of this blend. There's a hay element to the palate, as well as flavors of lime and lemon peels and an earthy finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: ONX 2018 Indie Blanc White (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Spring-blossom and white stone fruit aromas form the delicately enticing nose. On the crisp palate, vibrant acidity underscores ripe pear and Meyer lemon before a tangy saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2019 White (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)

Appellation: San Diego County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Almost pink in the glass, this unique estate blend of 87% Viognier and 13% Pinot Gris offers cantaloupe and wet chalk aromas. There is a compelling sizzle to the palate, where lemon-blossom and dried apple flavors meet with a dusty minerality.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hungry Hawk 2019 Mélange Blanc White (San Diego County)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: In this ripe, dry wine, Sauvignon Blanc has been filled out with the honeyed tones of Gros Manseng. Apricots as well as green fruits are well balanced in this wine that will be at its best from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Uby 2019 No 1 White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Acacia flower, bitter almond and honey aromas mingle together in the glass. The bitter-almond note follows on to the medium-bodied palate, along with dried peach and mature pear before a saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vicentini Agostino 2017 Il Casale  (Soave)

Description: This vintage of d'Arenberg's Riesling-dominated white blend, is, like the Sauvignon Blanc, a little reductive at first. With swirling and warming in the glass it soon reveals appealing aromas of buttered green beans, lemons, figs, fresh green herbs and a saline note. Tongue-tingling acidity slices somewhat awkwardly through a slippery texture.                      Christina Pickard
Name: D'Arenberg 2018 The Stump Jump White (Adelaide Hills)

Description: Tropical fruit and peach aromas carry over to the crisp palate along with citrus and pineapple notes. It's refreshing, with vibrant acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Guerrieri Rizzardi 2019 Cuvée XX  (Soave Classico)

Description: Waxy apple and white fruit aromas are mildly briny. On the palate, this Viura-based blend is medium in size, with peachy weight. Flavors of nectarine and cider are perfectly good but basic and short, while this feels chunky and slightly viscous on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Muga 2018 White (Rioja)

Description: The broad-brimmed beret is a symbol of Gascony and this white wine, and its red partner, celebrate that relationship. This wine is smooth, with ripe apple and spicy pear flavors. It has delicious acidity and is totally ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2018 Beret Blanc  (Saint-Mont)

Description: Exotic fruit and fragrant spring wild flower aromas lead the way. On the lean, racy palate, vibrant acidity accompanies grapefruit, pineapple and apricot before a bitter almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Corte Mainente 2018 Tenda  (Soave Classico)

Description: Bright fruit-forward aromas stand out on the nose of this refreshing wine—ripe lemon, peach and papaya—followed by a palate that is less vibrant than the nose suggests but still offers a broad, creamy mouthfeel, balanced acidity and a fruity finish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Bremerton 2019 Matilda Plains Sauvignon Blanc Verdelho Sauvignon Blanc-Verdejo (Langhorne Creek)

Description: Golden hued, this is an opulent, highly perfumed skin contact Semillon-Viognier blend that explodes with aromas of honey, ginger, apples, butter and blossoms. With time in the glass, more toasted coconut and beeswax hand soap aromas reveal themselves. Despite the rich nose, the palate is bone-dry. But it lacks the vibrancy, textural interest and phenolic finish that make up many of the best amber wines.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Alpha Box & Dice 2017 Golden Mullet Fury White (McLaren Vale)

Description: Golden hued, this is an opulent, highly perfumed skin contact Semillon-Viognier blend that explodes with aromas of honey, ginger, apples, butter and blossoms. With time in the glass, more toasted coconut and beeswax hand soap aromas reveal themselves. Despite the rich nose, the palate is bone-dry. But it lacks the vibrancy, textural interest and phenolic finish that make up many of the best amber wines.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Alpha Box & Dice 2017 Golden Mullet Fury White (McLaren Vale)

Description: Aromas of toasted almond and yellow apple follow over to the fresh, tangy palate along with a hint of honey. Bright acidity gives it a crisp finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Corte Canella 2018 La Vero  (Soave)

Description: Spring field flower, apple and citrus aromas form the delicate nose. The refreshing, light-bodied palate offers yellow pear, Meyer lemon and bitter almond set against crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Santa Maria 2018 Lepiga  (Soave)

Description: Tropical fruit and elderflower aromas follow over the crisp light-bodied palate, along with grapefruit and yellow pear. A bitter almond note signals the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina di Monteforte 2019 Clivus  (Soave Classico)

Description: Spring wild flower and white stone fruit aromas lead the way. On the fresh, light-bodied palate, crisp acidity accompanies pear, pineapple and citrus. It closes on an almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Antica Corte 2019  Soave

Description: This has delicate scents of exotic fruit and a whiff of spring wild flower. On the refreshing palate, crisp acidity accompanies banana and green apple before a tangerine finish. It's light and easygoing but well made.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ilatium Morini 2018  Soave Classico

Description: Aromas of grapefruit, hay and wild herb follow over to the light-bodied, easy-drinking palate along with a hints of pineapple and bitter almond. Racy acidity keeps it refreshing.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Corte Mainente 2019 Vigna Cengelle  (Soave)

Description: The delicate nose suggests whiffs of white stone fruit while the racy palate offers lemon, yellow apple and a hint of honeyed almond. Vibrant acidity gives it a crisp close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Corte Sant'Alda 2018  Soave

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Intense herbal flavors make this a really crisp, fruity wine. Lively acidity and vivacious fruitiness are right out there. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Ménard 2019 Colombard & Sauvignon Blanc Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Crisp and full of black-currant flavors, this bright wine is light, poised while also intensely herbal. The wine is still a little young and a few months in bottle will calm it down. Drink from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Uby 2019 No 3 Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Tropical-fruit and elderflower aromas form the delicate nose. On the tangy palate, crisp acidity accompanies apricot, peach and the barest hint of almond. It's simple but well made.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Castelnuovo del Garda 2019  Soave

Description: Spring blossom and summer orchard fruit form the delicate nose. It's tangy and refreshing, offering white peach, yellow pear and a hint of beeswax, alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Girardi 2018  Soave Classico

Description: Stalky aromas struggle with freshness and clarity, while this Viura-led blend feels round and full, with bold acidity. Briny apple flavors remain briny on a finish that adds mild bitterness to the package.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Luis Cañas 2018 White (Rioja)

Description: Light white fruit aromas and a slight hint of oak are met with mild notes of green herbs and grass. This is medium in body, with grabby oak-based tannins. Cidery, slightly briny white fruit flavors finish woody, which is line for barrel-fermented white Rioja.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Montecillo 2018 Blanco Fermentado En Barrica White (Rioja)

Description: Spring wild flower and white stone fruit aromas form the delicate nose. On the informal, easygoing palate, refreshing acidity accompanies pear and green apple. It's simple but well made.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Santa Sofia 2019 Montefoscarino  (Soave Classico)

Description: Aromas of banana follow over to the simple palate along with green melon and a candied lemon-drop note. It's informal and refreshing, with bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Corte Adami 2019  Soave

Description: The shy nose doesn't give much away while the crisp palate suggests mature yellow apple, beeswax and a hint of honey. It's light bodied, with brisk acidity and a bitter almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Acinum 2018  Soave Classico

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This is an attractive, fruity wine with a soft texture and crisp green-apple flavors. The juicy character is immediately attractive, full of freshness and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2019 Brumes de Gascogne Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This informal white has subtle aromas suggesting spring wild flower and apple. On the racy, light-bodied palate, crisp acidity carries white peach and a candied note. It's simple but well made.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vicentini Agostino 2018 Terrelunghe  (Soave)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: An intense, catty wine, this has gooseberry flavors and tight, crisp acidity. Hints of black currants come through as well as freshness. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Ménard 2019 La Marina Cuvée Océane White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This simple white has subdued aromas green melon. On the simple palate, crisp acidity accompanies suggestions of apple and almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Antica Corte 2019  Soave Classico

Description: Crisp and informal, this simple white has delicate aromas and flavors suggesting citrus and apple. It closes on a bitter note of almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Santi 2018  Soave Classico

Description: This informal white has aromas and flavors suggesting green apple and Bartlett pear. It's extremely simple but refreshing, with crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monte Zovo 2019  Soave

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: The epitome of an easy-going Gascon wine, this is bright and herbal, with soft green-fruit flavors. It is tangy and totally ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2019 Colombelle Colombard-Sauvignon Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This has an extremely shy nose that eventually reveals whiffs of white flower and citrus. On the fresh, simple palate, crisp acidity accompanies suggestions of banana and almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina di Gambellara 2019 Monopolio  (Soave Classico)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Intensely herbal, this is a green-fruit-flavored wine. Acidity is very present, giving gooseberry and green-plum flavors. Drink now,                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Ménard 2019 Cuvée Marine White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This grassy, herbal wine with a catty edge is fruity, crisp and citrus flavored. It's a blend of Colombard, Sauvignon Blanc and Gros Manseng, with the Gros Manseng adding a warmer, honeyed note. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Haut Marin 2019 Fossiles White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This has an extremely shy nose that eventually reveals whiffs of cedar and yellow flower. The lean, palate is also subdued, offering the merest suggestions of pear and vanilla before an abrupt, bitter almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Erbice 2018 Panvinio  (Soave Superiore)

Description: Packed in an extremely heavy bottle, this simple white has subdued aromas of spring blossom and a whiff of citrus. On the informal, rather diluted palate, crisp acidity accompanies grapefruit and a hint of pineapple.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Aldegheri 2019 Mondello  (Soave Classico)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Bright and herbal, this is a crisp, green-fruit-flavored wine. Its acidity and brightness are refreshing and tangy. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Ménard 2019 Colombard & Ugni Blanc Colombard-Ugni Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: The combination of tensely herbal Colombard and soft, honeyed Gros Manseng doesn't quite work. The intense herbal flavors dominate, leaving an odd balance.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2019 Domaine de Cassaigne Le Labyrinthe White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This informal white has an extremely shy nose that eventually reveals hints of wet metal. It's extremely simple and diluted, offering mere suggestions of stone fruit and bitter almond alongside brisk acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Adalia 2018 Singan  (Soave)

Description: The first whiff is of pear drop but that is swiftly followed by lifted herbal notes of dried hay flowers and more subtle white summer blossom. The body comes in, with unexpected concentration and texture, sculpted by vivid, insistent freshness. This is what the magic of field blends is all about: effortless aromatic complexity and textural experience. The finish is long and dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Stift Klosterneuburg 2019 White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: A blend of Savagnin and Chardonnay, this is now mature and has a strongly yeasty character. Nutty with vanilla and touches of wood aging, the wine has an oxidative, deliciously sipping character. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Rolet Père et Fils 2013 Tradition White (Arbois)

Description: Ripe fruit, heavy oak and related spice and wood-grain aromas create a full nose that's classic for white Rioja. Based on Tempranillo Blanco, Viura and Maturana, this feels racy with a resiny offset. Spiced apple and pear aromas are lightly baked, while this age-worthy blend tastes of farm-fresh butter on the finish. For fans of barrel-aged whites, especially Chardonnay, this is very much worth trying; drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Tobía 2016 Óscar Tobía Blanco Reserva White (Rioja)

Description: Pear and freesia notes have an unusual creaminess on the nose, accentuated by bright lemon. These aromatic themes continue on the palate where they are projected against a lovely, pithy textural backdrop on a concentrated and very juicy, fresh palate. This is unusual, appetizing, aromatic and very moreish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Martinshof 2019 Gemischter Satz White (Niederösterreich)

Description: Lemon notes on the nose are subtle at first, then propelled by the slight spritz which also makes itself felt on the juicy body. Mandarin and mirabelle shine, with their fruity purity and ripeness, as freshness frames them all the way to the moreish finish. This is very refreshing and rather irresistible.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Mayer am Pfarrplatz 2019 White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: Made with 90% Sauvignon and 10% Trebbiano vinified in 30% amphora, 10% oak and the rest in steel, this boasts classic varietal aromas of tropical fruit, crushed tomato vine and gooseberry. It's savory, linear and tangy, delivering juicy pineapple, grapefruit, cantaloupe, thyme and mouthwatering mineral alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fontodi 2018 Meriggio White (Toscana)

Description: A blend of mostly Pinot Bianco, Pinot Grigio and Chardonnay with smaller amounts of Kerner, Müller-Thurgau and Sauvignon, this white carries aromas of hawthorn, white stone fruit and graphite. Elegant and savory, the medium-bodied palate doles out white peach, yellow pear, citrus and tangy mineral set against fresh acidity. A hazelnut note lingers on the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Kurtatsch 2017 Amos White (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Nectarine, white-flower, wet stone and clean chalk aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There's a smooth entry to the palate, where polished touches of pome fruit and pineapple meet with salted macadamia nuts on the long finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: McClain Cellars 2017 Camping in Clouds Reserve White (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of tropical fruit, graphite, white rose and Alpine herb surge out of the glass on this fragrant white. A blend of Riesling, Chardonnay, Sauvignon, Kerner and late-harvested Traminer, the medium-bodied savory palate evokes ripe apricot, grapefruit, pineapple and tangy saline alongside bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franz Haas 2018 Manna White (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: One wonders why this succulent blend is not more common across Oregon. Here it's cofermented Pinot Blanc (60%) and Pinot Gris (40%), resulting in a richly fruity wine with an appealing mix of apple, melon and pear. The spot-on ripeness keeps the acidity in check—just enough to brighten up the fruit and cleanse the palate, but not tilting over into sourness. A hint of toast from aging in neutral wood finishes the flavors.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Sokol Blosser 2018 Estate White (Dundee Hills)

Description: Cheverny in Touraine is a small appellation known for generous white wines. This juicy, rich wine with a dry, peppery aftertaste has a fresh element that strides through the center. It needs to age so drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Maison 2019 Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay (Cheverny)

Description: A blend of 75% Grenache Blanc and 25% Viognier, this white offers a steely nose and sizzling acidity on the palate, with layered flavors of peach, lemon and stone. With a touch of viscosity, it's refreshing and energetic in feel.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Noble Tree 2017 Noble Blanc Estate White (Chalk Hill)

Description: This blends 55% Albarino, 30% Pinot Gris and 15% Riesling. Together they make for a fruity, savory and steely experience of waxy apricot, apple and austere texture, finishing bright in wet stone.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Thirty-Seven 2018 Tolay Blanc White (Petaluma Gap)

Description: Predominantly Chenin Blanc, this is an attractively crisp and textured wine. Aged in the caves of Saumur, the wine bubbles with a nutty character as well as green apples and great acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Petite Roche NV Brut  (Saumur)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: The name is a variation on the goose that laid the golden eggs (in this case a hen). This wine's blend of the two Manseng grapes is sweet and honeyed while keeping the freshness these two grapes always offer. Apricots, a touch of late-harvest concentration and beautiful acidity all come together. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Famille Laplace 2018 La Poule aux Oeufs d'Or White (Vin de France)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: There's a fascinating backstory behind this golden-hued, late-harvest blend of Pinot Gris and Sauvignon Blanc, which was almost thrown out and evaporated from 12 barrels to six over the years. The result is a nose loaded with nut, honey and Bourbon aromas, while the viscous palate offers caramelized lemon, macadamia and hazelnut flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Monte De Oro 2008 Forty 85 Lost Gold White (Temecula)

Description: A blend of 70% Vermentino, Fiano, Verdicchio, Manzoni Bianco and Petit Manseng all grown in a single vineyard, this has subdued aromas suggesting yellow stone fruit, Mediterranean herb and yellow wild flower. The full-bodied palate offers apricot, honey and a hint of saline alongside fresh acidity. It closes on a bitter almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Guado al Melo 2018 Criseo White (Bolgheri)

Description: Round and structured, this medium-bodied white has flavors of ripe apricot, lemon drop and passion fruit. Tangy acidity and a hint of saline lift the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Decugnano dei Barbi 2017 Mare Antico  (Orvieto Classico)

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of melon, apple and dried flower stalks carry the nose. The palate is a bit oily in feel, yet properly lifted by citric acidity that builds. There's a white-tea-like grip to the close, along with lingering tones of peach and apple.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Novaripa 2018 Monatic Gold White (Terre di Chieti)

Description: Apple and pear aromas are clean and fresh, while this blend of Viura, Sauvignon Blanc and Malvasia feels solid and healthy. Mild citrus and basic white-fruit flavors finish short but true.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2018 Blanco White (Rioja)

Description: A blend of 81% Sauvignon Blanc, 10% Vermentino, 6% Viogner and 3% Verdicchio, this has subdued aromas of toasted oak, acacia and ripe yellow apple. The oak aromas carry over to the shy, medium-bodied palate, along with hints of grapefruit and roasted coffee bean before a rather lean, drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ornellaia 2017 Poggio alle Gazze White (Toscana)

Description: Citrus, lychee and tropical fruit aromas come mostly from the 85% Torrontés that makes up this blend along with Riesling. Racy acidity pumps up the gas in front of orange, tangerine, pineapple and mango flavors. While there's nothing complex about this, it's bright, racy and refreshing.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Amalaya 2019 White (Salta)

Description: This is Maturana Blanca, and it's a departure from the norm. Waxy, almost stalky aromas open the show, backed by a citric palate, with pineapple acidity. Apple, grapefruit and lightly oxidized flavors are braced by core acidity on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Nivarius 2016 Finca La Nevera White (Rioja)

Description: A 50-50 blend of organically-grown Chardonnay and Viognier, this has aromas of tropical fruit, apricot and toasted nut. The palate is structured but more restrained than the nose, offering grapefruit and fennel seed alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Palazzetta 2018 Prima Viola White (Maremma Toscana)

Description: Made with Vermentino and Viognier, this has subdued aromas suggesting yellow stone fruit and a whiff of spring field flower. On the bright, light-bodied palate, crisp acidity accompanies yellow peach and lemon zest before a tangy saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Pinciana 2018 Airali White (Maremma Toscana)

Description: This yellow-tinted blend of Viura and Sauvignon Blanc opens with apple and pear aromas that come across as ripe. A pulpy palate has the texture of grape skins, while this tastes of melon and peach prior to a finish that offers an apricot note before falling off.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Cofrade 2018 Viura-Sauvignon Blanc (Rioja)

Description: A blend of Vermentino, Ansonica and Viognier, this has delicate aromas of white spring flower and white stone fruit. The tangy light-bodied palate is also on the delicate side, suggesting white peach, pineapple and citrus alongside crisp acidity. It closes on a saline note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Mortelle 2018 Vivia White (Maremma Toscana)

Description: Peach and Mediterranean brush aromas follow through to the light-bodied palate, along with a hint of pineapple. Tangy acidity keeps it fresh.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bruni 2018 Plinio White (Maremma Toscana)

Description: A blend of 60% Gewürztraminer and 40% Riesling, this offers lilac and baby powder aromas that carry to the palate. It offers fleshy peach and zippy Meyer lemon flavors. It's off-dry, with a slightly grainy, sugary finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Pillitteri 2017 Fusion Gewürztraminer-Riesling (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of 90% Albariño and 10% Viognier. The aromas smell a bit funky out of the gate, resolving to show tones of melon, peach, pear and flower. Lean pear flavors follow, fleshing out with time open. It doesn't entirely stand up on its own, but there are interesting things happening.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Simpatico 2018 The Fanatic White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A moderately fresh nose is woolly smelling and quiet, while this blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Gris and Sauvignon Blanc has a pineapple juice feel and similar flavors of pineapple and orange. On the finish, this is creamy and round, with a final kick of tropical fruit acidity.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2018 Gaia Made With Organic Grapes White (Tupungato)

Description: A punchy, citric nose offers a hint of green herbs, while this blend of Viura and Malvasia is fresh and light in feel. White grapefruit and apple flavors end with a reprise of mild green-herb notes.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Baron De Ley 2018 White (Rioja)

Description: Crisp Arinto and herbal Sauvignon Blanc come together in this fruity wine. They bring freshness, green-apple and melon fruits along with fine, fresh acidity. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2019 Espirito Lagoalva White (Tejo)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of Pinot Gris, Sémillon, Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay. The aromas are light, with notes of mineral, wet copper penny and jasmine. Linear tropical fruit flavors follow. It's an innocuous easy drinker.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Maryhill 2018 Winemaker's White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Lemon-lime aromas are slightly green, while this feels round but flat along its edges. Citrusy flavors are more round than sharp, while this holds onto its fullness through the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: La Purísima 2018 White (Yecla)

Description: Hints of fig, pineapple and butter give this full-bodied wine a ripe, rich expression, while a soft, full body makes it rather fat in texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Paskett 2018 Chingona White (Lodi)

Description: Made with Chardonnay and Vermentino, this zesty, informal white has subdued aromas evoking beeswax and a whiff of apricot. The simple, light-bodied palate suggests hints of yellow apple and citrus alongside brisk acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Banfi 2018 Centine White (Toscana)

Description: Uncomplicated melon and yeasty vanilla aromas precede a ripe and lively palate, with punchy citrus, melon and tropical-fruit flavors. Tangy acidity pushes this basic white blend from Spain's southeast.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Luzón 2018 Luzó Coleccion Blanco White (Jumilla)

Description: This canned wine has an earthy aroma that gives way to fairly rich flavors and a soft mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Firehouse Can Company NV Mancan White (California)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Dusty orange-peel aromas lead to a palate that's mildly citric in feel but mostly just blunt. Citrus and dry melon flavors deliver the basics, making this right for easy quaffing.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Dominio de Eguren 2018 Protocolo White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An earthy aroma carries to good mainstream fruit flavors, tangy acidity and a little bite of tannin on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Hovey 2018 C2 White (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Dull melon and apple juice aromas start this off. This blend of Riesling, Albariño and Savagnin tastes of briny white fruits and mustard seed. It's an odd mix, a viscous texture.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Alicia 2017 Tiara White (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: A mild nose leads to the rounded palate of melon and tropical fruit. It lacks edge and definition, and carries a slightly bitter edge.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Chakana 2018 Nuna Vineyard White (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: A hint of smoke envelops a creamy, mellow nose that speaks of earth, yeast and pear. The palate of this wine turns away from fruit and onto texture, presenting a buffered but pithy earthiness. Highlights of citrus peel frame everything with precision, deepening that earthy impression.The finish is just about dry but superclean and incisive with its lemon straightness. Drink now–2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2016 Engelgarten White (Alsace)

Description: A touch of honey clings to baked-pear notes on the nose of this wine, promising richness. The palate is generous and mellow with ripe pear but also pervaded by freshness. It has a hint of dark berry and phenolic richness that veers into oiliness, but a vein of freshness keeps this on the right side of ripeness. This wine is about power, subtle aromas and full-on texture. The finish is dry and long. Drink now–2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2015 Gruenspiel White (Alsace)

Description: Smoke, earth, stone and citrus-lifted notions of Mirabelle plum rise from the glass with uncommon force. The vivid palate of this wine plunges into ripe citric depths, suggests profound fruit and freshness. Citrus lends precision within that generosity. This wine is creamy and generous, off dry but driven. Citrus and Mirabelle aromas on the finish seal this deliciousness. Drink now–2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2015 Grasberg White (Alsace)

Description: Ripe pear, rye bread and chalk take turns on the intriguing nose of this wine. The rounded palate offers generous and mellow notions of baked apple with hints of fresh lemon zest and heady Kirsch. There is heat and power here, but also depth and energy. This wine shines with freshness despite the honeyed, baked fruit richness at its core. The finish is off dry and long. Drink now–2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2015 Burg White (Alsace)

Description: With rich notions of cream, baked apple and apple crumble, the nose of this wine conveys mellow richness. Smoothness also characterizes the rounded, generous palate where the creaminess takes on an even richer mouthfeel. Baked pear, a hint of banana and dried lemon peel lend fruity notions and freshness to this richly textured wine that reveals wet chalk, beeswax and yeasty savor. This huge wine will evolve. Drink now–2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2015 Schoffweg White (Alsace)

Description: Subtle but pure notes of mandarin play on the apple-scented nose of this wine alongside floral notions. The rounded palate shows an immense juiciness and compact, concentrated fluidity that goes down like oil. It has a firm, stony backdrop and quite a bit of structure that nonetheless lets the fruit take center stage. The finish is dry, fresh and lasting.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2017 Langenberg White (Alsace)

Description: Citrus richness emanates from the nose of this wine that holds ripe, almost honeyed, pear as a base. On the palate, concentrated, chalky and honeyed richness is rounded, textured, off dry and fluid. The wine has citric drive at its core and a certain coolness, despite the honeyed, full-fruited richness, creating a lovely contrast. Texture and structure are gilded by fruit. Drink now–2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2015 Rotenberg White (Alsace)

Description: Earth and russet-pear peel on the nose of this wine have a lemony edge. A flinty overtone carries over onto the fresh palate where mellow apple and bright lemon flavors are amplified on the textured, expansive palate. This wine is smooth in flavor but taut in structure and rather compelling. The finish is dry and vivid.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Marc Kreydenweiss 2018 Stierkopf White (Alsace)

Description: Chalk, chamomile tincture and dried lemon peel have immense lift on the nose of this wine. They also pervade the bright, balm-like but concentrated palate with their aromatic intensity. This wine is fluid and layered, showing signs of evolution that is set to continue for many years. Gentle sweetness balances the bracing freshness and makes this a real experience. The finish is off dry but very balanced and long. Drink until 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2015 Clos du Zahnacker White (Alsace)
