Description: A smoky, earthy nose on this wine initially masks the fruit, which becomes apparent on the smooth, taut, fresh and concentrated palate. It offers superripe pear and lemon with piercing freshness but also a note of bitter citrus pith that lends texture. This wine is intense and still a little young. Drink 2023–2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Marc Kreydenweiss 2018 Clos du Val d'Éléon White (Alsace)

Description: The nose of this inviting wine offers a lick of fir honey, whiffs of damask rose and whirls of peach. Off dry, textured and generous, the wine stays on the right side of freshness but showers you with generous ripeness. A lovely texture sets a counterpoint.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2016 Berckem White (Alsace)

Description: Salty yeast and fresh red-apple peel make for a nose that is both savory and fruity. The palate of this wine adds bright lemon freshness to this beautifully textured wine that still shimmers with yeasty funk. It has intensity and personality but above all pervasive, full-flavored freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Marc Kreydenweiss 2018 Pinot Boir Blanc White (Alsace)

Description: The owners of classed growth Château Bouscaut have produced a wood-aged, lightly herbal and ripe wine from their other estate. This wine has spice and plenty of youthful acidity from the 80% of Sauvignon Blanc in the blend. It will broaden and become a rich wine in the medium term. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lamothe-Bouscaut 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A heady whiff of rose petal hits the nose before creamy notions of Mirabelle and pear take over. They also dominate the palate of this wine with mellow, creamy fruitiness that gains structure from a pleasantly bitter texture and freshness. That floral notion resurfaces on the aromatic, dry and fresh finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2017 Alsace White (Alsace)

Description: A taut and mineral-driven wine, this is crisp, textured and fresh. Wood aging has given the 60% Sauvignon Blanc in the blend a lift, bringing all the fruit flavors to a bright point. Drink the wine from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut Selve 2018  Graves

Description: A rare blend of Gewürztraminer, Riesling and Malvasia, this wine is spicy, fruity and deliciously refreshing. The mineral edge that comes from the 60% Riesling adds to the wine's fine texture. The wine is ready to drink but will be better from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Valle Pradinhos 2018 Reserva Branco White (Trás-os-Montes)

Description: Something spicy, akin to russet-pear peel and grapefruit, plays on the nose of this wine. The palate shows fresh but concentrated pear flavors and has real, dry impact on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Ansen 2017 Sal Weingarten White (Alsace)

Description: Ripe pear aromas and subtle floral hints play on the slightly aromatic nose of this wine. The dry palate comes in with zesty, ripe mandarin fruit and a rich texture. It's a refreshing, rounded and fruity wine with a dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Frey-Sohler 2018 Rittersberg White (Alsace)

Description: A floral topnote of honeysuckle shines on the nose of this wine alongside orange peel. The palate is delicate, aromatic and dry, while the finish is clean and refreshing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2018 7 Grains White (Alsace)

Description: Bright notes of freshly cut, ripe pear on the nose come with hints of creaminess and citrus. The palate of this wine is bright, fruity and comes with a dry, refreshing and clean finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2018 Maru White (Alsace)

Description: Slight notes of ripe yellow pear appear shyly on the nose of this wine. The palate comes in with freshness supported by very slight spritz. Lemony brightness dominates the dry finish of this slender wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hugel 2018 Gentil Hugel White (Alsace)

Description: An exotic nose lends notes of sandalwood, rosewater and spice. The palate of this wine stays light, translucent and bright, shimmering with freshness and aromatics on the easy, light body. It finishes fresh and dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Pierre Sparr 2018 One White (Alsace)

Description: Honeysuckle, mango and passion fruit on the nose of this wine spell fruit and exoticism. The fruitiness is boosted on the light, easy and fresh body by some residual sweetness on the balanced, off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2018 Blue Tie White (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: An overtone of honeysuckle clings to a hint of earthiness on the subtle nose of this wine. The palate presents vivid freshness, even zestiness. The body is light, easy, dry and very bright.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2018 Alsace White (Alsace)

Description: A burnished gold color and lightly oxidized aromas of spiced pumpkin and dried apricots lead to a round and pulpy palate with modest acidity. This orange wine made from Petit and Gros Manseng grapes tastes of spiced squash and bitter skins, while a chai flavor controls the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bizarra Extravaganza 2019 Vino Natural Naranja Bizarra White (Uruguay)

Description: Sunny notes of ripe Golden Delicious apple are appetizing on the nose of this wine. A little spritz on the palate adds to the sense of easy, fruity freshness on this very light, dry and refreshing wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff & Irion 2018 Crustacés White (Alsace)

Description: Gentle floral and spicy notes hover attractively on the nose of this light-bodied wine. The palate is mild but fresh and very slender, while the finish is dry and slightly aromatic.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Allimant-Laugner 2018 Gentil White (Alsace)

Description: Gentle pear and honeysuckle notes have a hint of citrus on the nose of this wine. It's light, slightly aromatic, slender and dry, with a feel of spring and ease about it. The finish is dry and refreshing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Henri Schoenheitz 2018 Alsace Sec White (Alsace)

Description: The 60% Sémillon in the blend of this wine gives it a ripe texture. Hints of tropical fruits as well as green-plum flavors are balanced by the smoothing effect of six months' aging in wood. The wine will be ready from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château le Bonnat 2018  Graves

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried lemon blossoms, citrus rinds and a hint of quinine show on the nose of this blend of 64% Sauvignon Blanc, 20% Viognier and 16% Grenache Blanc. The palate is tightly wound, offering ripe melon and peach flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: ONX 2018 Field Day White (Templeton Gap District)

Description: Subtle pear notes are all that can be made out on the shy nose of this wine. The palate adds zesty lemon to the light, balanced, easy-drinking body. The finish is clean, dry and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2018 Black Tie White (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: The nose on this wine is shy and almost neutral and the palate stays similiarly subdued. The clean body shows friendly pear and apple notes, finishing off dry and balanced.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2018 White Tie White (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: Funky yeast still plays on the nose of this wine while the palate broadens to bruised apple and pear peel, adding some bitterness. The finish is dry and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Michel Fonne 2018 Grains de Génie White (Alsace)

Description: A shy nose on this wine leads onto a slender, bright and easy palate where pear and lemon notes are joined by pithy earthiness. The finish is fresh and dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine G. Metz 2018 Cuvée Harmony White (Alsace)

Description: All the neutral nose of this wine promises is freshness. The palate offers ripe, mellow pear boosted by slight sweetness. It finishes off dry and rounded.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine de la Tour Blanche 2018 Mystère White (Alsace)

Description: A pronounced swampy aroma mars the first whiff of this rich, ripe wine before it brings on superripe, sweet peach and melon flavors. Full body, some alcoholic heat and a toasted nut character give it a huge and heavy presence.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Peirano 2017 The Other White (Lodi)

Description: Only a faint hint of pear fruit appears on the nose. of this wine. The palate stays similarly neutral but is fresh, clean, bright, light and dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: André Kientzler NV Edelzwicker White (Alsace)

Description: Aromas of green banana, tropical fruit and brine open this Viognier-dominant blend. Apple pie, spice and salt flavors burn a bit as they fade out on a creamy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Estampa 2018 Reserva Viognier-Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Melony aromas are a touch stalky, while this blend of Albariño, Chardonnay and Pinot Gris feels plump and balanced by bright acidity. Salty, dry flavors of melon and stone fruits are quiet on the fade.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Establecimiento Juanico 2019 Don Pascual Coastal White (Uruguay)

Description: Brilliant gold-flecked-amber in the glass, this Hungarian stunner hails from the Szt. Tamas vineyard located on one of Tokaj's most iconic hills. It has aromas of wildflower honey, ripe peach, honeysuckle blossom, freshly sliced apricot and acacia flowers. It is an ethereal blend of Furmint, Harslevelü and Muscat. Silky smooth on entry, it offers enticing flavors of white peach, apricot preserves, honeycomb and acacia honey. It has beautiful heft on the palate with balanced acidity and crisp minerality. The elegant sweetness is perfectly foiled by bracing acidity and crispness in the finish. This is how Hungarian Tokaj Aszü wine should be made. Drink through 2045.                      Jeff Jenssen
Designation: SZT. Tamás Single Vineyard 6 Puttonyos Aszú First Growth
Name: Royal Tokaji 2013 SZT. Tamás Single Vineyard 6 Puttonyos Aszú First Growth White (Tokaj)

Description: Brad Hickey's wild fermented and unusual field blend of Riesling and Semillon has been a solid offering since he launched his McLaren Vale label. Tasting it with a bit of age shows how remarkably it holds up in the bottle. Open and expressive, it has mellowed to a pale honey color and billows notes of nuts, honeycomb, blossoms, fresh ginger and a distinctly “Brash” mineral note of sunbaked clay and stones. In the mouth, flavors take a back seat to texture, which washes over the tongue, lifted by bright acidity. A long, concentrated, spicy finish closes things out slowly and deliciously.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Brash Higgins 2016 R/SM White (McLaren Vale)

Description: A blend of Fiano, Vermentino, Greco and Arinto from Riverland rock stars Ashley and Holly Ratcliffe, this wine is a bit reductive to start, highlighting umami seaweed characters, but it opens with time in the glass to reveal grapefruit, stone fruit and honeyed floral tones. The palate is beautifully balanced and textured, with citrus pith raking across a powdery mouthfeel toward a long, tangy finish. Food-friendly and full of personality.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Ricca Terra 2018 Bronco Buster White (Riverland)

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Tropical fruit, honeysuckle, yellow stone fruit and crushed herb aromas shape the nose on this blend of Grechetto, Vermentino, Chardonnay and Procanico. On the creamy palate, tangy mineral notes evoking saline add depth to juicy peach, honeydew melon and lemon drop. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Villa Barbi Il Bianco Mare Antico
Name: Decugnano dei Barbi 2018 Villa Barbi Il Bianco Mare Antico  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Description: This is an ethereal wine, with intense acidity beneath the honey and dried-apricot flavors. Its lift and lightness mean that the considerable sweetness is never cloying, always balanced. The wine can age, although it is hard to resist the temptation to drink it now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Nigri 2017 Pas de Deux  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: This skin-contact Sauvignon Blanc bursts from the glass in flowers, citrus, ginger, honey and green herbs. The palate takes it up a notch with its waxy texture, juicy and pithy fruit, wonderfully prickly acidity and long gingery finish. This Sauvignon Blanc on steroids is sunshine in a glass.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Good Intentions 2018 Relatively White (Mount Gambier)

Description: This combines 83% Sémillon and 17% Sauvignon Blanc into a measured late-harvest botrytized wine aged in 100% new French oak. A sweet, nutty nose of peanut brittle, caramel and honey complement a midpalate of baked apple and biscuit, finishing crisp and even.                      Virginie Boone
Name: V. Sattui 2012 Regina Late Harvest Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A big burst of peachy fruit starts off this soft, round, full-bodied white blend. There are nine grapes in the mix, none dominant. Lovely details of Meyer lemon, orange and tangerine follow, with a lively, spicy finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Designation: Prayer Rock Vineyards Matrix Estate Selection
Name: Reustle 2018 Prayer Rock Vineyards Matrix Estate Selection White (Umpqua Valley)

Description: This highly perfumed beauty is made predominantly from Muscat Blanc à Petit Grains with 15% Fiano, and it's hard not to fall for its charms. Exploding from the glass with aromas of peach, pineapple skin and honeysuckle, the Muscat, as per usual with this variety, makes itself known loud and clear. On the palate, prickly acidity freshens and brightens all the heady fruit, steering it clear of heaviness or overt ripeness. Drink now chilled, or pair with your favorite spicy dish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Ricca Terra 2018 Daisy Chain White (Riverland)

Description: Yellow spring flower, pear and crushed stone aromas lift out of the glass. On the rounded, medium-bodied palate, bright acidity and a marked mineral note of saline accompany yellow apple, white peach and lemon drop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Decugnano dei Barbi 2018 Villa Barbi  (Orvieto Classico)

Appellation: Madera County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Butter, butterscotch and hints of honey give this full-bodied wine an indulgent personality, but it's nice and dry and well balanced, too. Peach and apricot open up on the palate and a sense of concentration builds through the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Stockman 2018 Côtés et Vallée White (Madera County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A unique blend of Viognier (49%), Roussanne (41%) and Riesling. The aromas are fruit-forward, with notes of ripe peach, flower and melon. The palate drinks off-dry, rounded in feel but still, light, with citrus, stone fruit and floral flavors. It has a pleasing yum factor.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Brian Carter 2018 Oriana White Wine Blend White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This dessert-style wine does not overdo the sweetness, but has a subtle, nutty aroma, then offers ample flavors of toasted nuts, honey and butterscotch on a rich texture. It's moderately sweet, full bodied and complex.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Intercoastal 2017 Dolce Blanc White (California)

Description: This small-batch producer from the tiny wine region of Pemberton in Western Australia produces high quality wines in a traditional Burgundian and Bordelais vein. The Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon blend offers bright citrus, passion fruit, honeycomb and dried herbal notes. The palate zips with fresh acidity and a lovely, powdery texture, softened by fleshy fruit. An ultra food-friendly drop with the ability to age several more years in bottle.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Picardy 2017 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Pemberton)

Description: This Macedonian white blend has aromas of lemon grass, white flowers and kumquat. It is well balanced on the palate with flavors of lychee, lemon grass and just a touch of clover honey.                      Jeff Jenssen
Name: Popova Kula 2018 Aristokrat Temjanika White (Tikves)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A field blend of all the winery's white grapes, sourced from a decades-old vineyard, this is borderline sour but will appeal to those with a preference for high-acid white wines. Lemon and grapefruit dominate in a powerful, fruit-centric effort with a long lasting finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Abiqua Wind NV Lot 17 Intertwined White (Willamette Valley)

Description: This rich wine offers flavors of honey and yellow fruits as well as the intense acidity typical of the grape. It has deceptive power and would benefit from another few months aging. Drink from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2017 Cami Salié  (Jurançon Sec)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: Vineyards of the grand Alorna estate with its aristocratic house and stables has given an intense, perfumed wine. Crisp white fruits are laced with acidity and citrus fruits. It is already balanced, just hinting at the wood aging. Drink from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta da Alorna 2018 White (Tejo)

Description: Fermented and aged in wood, this honeyed wine has a liquorous texture and yellow fruits cut with orange zest. It is a rich, ripe wine, with intense sweetness balanced by the dry botrytis flavor at its core. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Kalian 2016  Monbazillac

Description: Honeyed, dried-apricot aromas show strongly on the palate of this blend of Loin de l'Oeil and Sauvignon Blanc. It feels ripe rather than great rich, balanced by lifted acidity. Drink from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Rotier 2017 Les Gravels Doux White (Gaillac)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: The white wine of the Madiran region is called Pacherenc. This blend of Gros Manseng and Petit Courbu is dry, ripe and rich with apricot and citrus flavors. Density and freshness meld in a wine that will be ready to drink from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2018 Lou Blanc  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)

Description: This is a delicate and approachable blend of 54% Semillon, 43% Sauvignon Blanc and 3% Verdelho from one of Australia's biodynamic rock stars. The tree fruit, pineapple, grass and dried herbal characters tiptoe across the tongue amid a texture that is both chalky and slippery, popping with prickly acidity and begging to be sipped, as the name suggests, while making merry in the summer sunshine.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Cullen 2018 Dancing in the Sun Wilyabrup White (Margaret River)

Description: The two Mansengs in tandem have produced a powerfully ripe wine, rich in apple, yellow fruit and honey flavors. Wood aging has augmented the wine's richness and brought in spice. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Nigri 2018 Pierre de Lune  (Jurançon Sec)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: This Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc blend from the most inland subregion of the Great Southern shows lots of varietal character from both grapes, particularly on the nose. Aromas of lemon, stone fruit, lanolin, snow pea and tomato leaf flow into a palate that wants for a bit more texture, maybe even some phenolics for added complexity. What's there is cheek-biting acidity amid chalky yet bouncy fruit. Give this another year or two in bottle to gain complexity.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Alkoomi 2018 Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Frankland River)

Description: Loin de l'Oeil and Sauvignon Blanc grapes bring together rounded yellow fruits and crisp citrus. This wine has pear and apricot flavors and attractively bright acidity. It's almost ready, so drink this fragrant wine from mid 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Rotier 2018 Les Gravels Banc White (Gaillac)

Description: Aged in tank, this is a crisp, ripe wine. Acidity is softened by an edge of yellow fruits and by the rich, creamy texture. The wine is full and stylish, with a fresh aftertaste. Drink from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Kalian 2018 White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: There's a bit of rubbery reduction on this white blend (a combo of Chardonnay and Arneis, rumor has it, although details aren't readily available), but it blows off relatively quickly with time in the glass, revealing bright citrus and stone fruit notes along with underlying florals and minerality. Light to medium bodied, there's a slippery mouthfeel, buoyed by prickly acidity. A straightforward but balanced drop.                      Christina Pickard
Name: First Drop 2017 The White One White (South Australia)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A blend of four typical grapes, including some honeyed Gros Manseng, this crisp, fresh wine has attractive touches of melon and yellow fruits. Lively and with bright acidity at the end, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine la Taste 2018 White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Despite its label, this wine is only partially made of Sauvignon Blanc, with three other grapes making up the rest of the blend. Nonetheless, a definite crisp herbal character gives the wine its shape and freshness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Tariquet 2018 Sauvignon Blanc White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Viognier, Muscat, Riesling and Gewürztraminer go into this curious blend that is spicy, low in acidity but high in ripe flavor. It's an aperitif wine that is ready to drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2018 La Cité Orientale White (Comté Tolosan)

Description: Mainly Gros Manseng, this blend has just a hint of honey within the crisp, dry fruitiness. A tangy citrus character gives texture to the wine with its floral aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2017 Beret Blanc  (Saint-Mont)

Description: This Macedonian white blend has aromas of Fuji apple, Bartlett pear and citrus blossom. In the mouth, there are flavors of white peach and dried Mediterranean herbs.                      Jeff Jenssen
Name: Popova Kula 2017 Altan White (Tikves)

Description: A blend of Rkatsiteli and Mtsvane, this light-straw-colored wine offers aromas of peach and jasmine. It is full in the mouth, with flavors of pear, apple and toasted pineapple with soft floral notes. There is a nice touch of rose petal on the soft finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Badagoni 2016 Kakhetian Noble White (Georgia)

Description: It's impressive what 10% Muscadelle can do to a Bordeaux-style white wine. It brings a perfumed character to the wine, softening the herbal intensity of Sauvignon Blanc. This is a rich, white and yellow-fruited wine with a full texture. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2018 Cuvée des Conti White (Bergerac Sec)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Colombard, Savignon Blanc and Gros Manseng go into this light, poised wine with hints of yellow fruits and honey plus lots of acidity. It is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2018 Pyrène L'Incontournable Cuvée Marine White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This crisp, fruity wine is shot through with acidity, with white-currant fruits and a bright herbal character. Cool, fragrant and fresh, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2018 Domaine San de Guilhem Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This wine has a nose of nectarine and phyllo dough. Slightly off dry, it features flavors of apple pie, ripe peach and honeysuckle with a softly sweet finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Dalton 2018 Canaan White (Galilee)

Description: Heirloom grapes Gros Manseng, Camarelet and Lauzet have produced this spicy, peppery wine. Acidity is muted by the spice and the full, ripe apple flavors. Drink this wine from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Nigri 2018 Confluence  (Jurançon Sec)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This wine is all about fruitiness, with touches of apples and a citrus ping. Crisply textured and lightly perfumed, it is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Maubet 2018 White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This aperitif-style wine is a blend of Gros Manseng and Sauvignon Blanc. It is crisply textured and light as a feather. Made from late harvest grapes, it is deliciously fruity and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2018 Pyrène L'Emoustillant Grains Dorés White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Produced by the Fontan family, this crisp and typically fruity wine is light and ready to drink. Citrus acidity is balanced by hints of honey over a tangy, young texture. Drink now for the freshness of the wine.                      Roger Voss
Name: Loubadère 2018 White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This wine has a nose of Gala apple and coffee beans. It is bright on the palate, with flavors of pear, kiwi and pink grapefruit. The finish is notable for a burst of Seville orange.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Sphera 2018 Signature White (Judean Hills)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Light and fruity, this wine has an attractive herbal character plus fresh, bright citrus flavors. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2018 Brumes de Gascogne Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This wine has a bouquet of passion fruit and cut grass. Flavors of lemon-lime, passion fruit, white chocolate and peppercorn are simultaneously bright but subdued, leading to an espresso-bean finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Sphera 2018 White Concepts First Page White (Judean Hills)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Estate-grown, this white combines 44% Viognier, 34% Roussanne, 17% Marsanne and 5% Grenache Blanc, calling itself a “Grape Wine” on the label. Structured, reductive and somewhat harsh, it holds back and is remiss in fruit.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Preston 2018 Madame Preston White (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: This will be a magnificent wine. Its structure, acidity and richness all show considerable potential. A crisp edge contrasts with the concentration and density that comes from the swaths of fruit. Wood aging has opened out the tanginess of a wine that will age over many years. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2017  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This rich, open wine has both acidity and impressively ripe white and yellow-fruit flavors. The creaminess creates a sense of richness underlined by the wood aging. This is a balanced wine, already well integrated and likely to age well. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2017  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This wine is distinct in its texture, with a mere hint of spice from wood. What makes it special is the harmony among perfume, acidity, texture and superb fruit. The wine finishes with a touch of saltiness. It needs plenty of time, don't drink before 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2017  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This wine is dense, with concentrated spice plus rich white and kiwi fruits. Acidity is prominent, giving the wine impressive fruitiness and aging potential as suggested by the texture and wood flavors. Drink this beautifully ripe wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Chevalier 2017  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This rich, full wine shows intense spice, fruits and a ripe texture that is nearly fully developed. A hint of tanginess emphasizes the richness of this powerful wine that brings in bits of spice and minerality. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2016  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This textured, crisp and herbal wine also has plenty of fruitiness. Green-fruit flavors balance with spice, hints of toast and taut aftertaste. While the wine could be drunk soon, giving it until 2021 would be better.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Olivier 2017  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This generous wine is full of white fruits and ripe acidity. A tangy texture balances this richness, giving edginess to the wine's structure. At this stage, the wine is young, needing plenty of time for the concentration to soften and allow the wine to open. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Couhins 2017  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This wine is crisp, fruity and zesty, with a mineral texture. Its herbal character dominates, bringing in green fruits and a beautiful grassy character. The wine is developing well but will be much better from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2017  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Yellow fruits mingle with ripe acidity and citrus in this second white wine of Haut-Brion. Its wood aging is a servant of the fruitiness and tangy texture. Just a hint of herbal flavors is a reminder that Sauvignon Blanc is important in the wine. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2017 La Clarté de Haut-Brion  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: A hint of melted butter accompanies the subtle apricot notes on the nose. The palate also has this sense of buffered roundness, of intense concentration buffered and cushioned by a soft layer of buttery, mellow roundness. Yet there is no fat on this wine; it is concentrated in its slender, grippy and slightly phenolic fashion, drawing you in with a bone-dry honesty. Lovely, unusual and very long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Rebenhof Aubell 2013 Herrenberg 500 White (Steirerland)

Description: Amber color and a funky nose of dried apple skins, lemon and a hint of wet loam signal a natural wine style. With air the nose gets increasingly aromatic, displaying notes of dried orange peel. The palate comes in with a real phenolic edge, bright acidity and a funky, animalistic notion of furred game, its utter dryness helps to make this distinct and visceral. Unusual but somehow very appealing in its dryness and luminous freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Schiefer & Domaines Kilger 2015 Weisser Schiefer M White (Weinland Österreich)

Description: This wine shines with bright green-plum and herbal flavors. Fruitiness is balanced by a texture that hints at ripeness and richness. Lightly spicy from wood aging, the wine has both a crisp texture and freshness at the end. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2017  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This rich, spicy wine from Philippe and Fabrice Reynaud offers cinnamon aromas and ripe citrus fruits. The combo of Sémillon, Sauvignon Blanc and Muscadelle makes the acidity just right for freshness. Drink this balanced and poised wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lugaud 2018  Graves

Description: Ripe Sémillon gives this wine a full, rich character. Acidity is well integrated into hints of minerality and green fruits. Lemon and pink grapefruit vie with the richer white fruits, combining in a harmonious whole at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2017 Le Petit Haut Lafitte  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: A hint of Mandarin orange, a full flash of red apple, an edge of earthy yeast. The nose certainly is appetizing and full-flavored. The palate is generous and full of that juicy apple ripeness and freshness that also has the texture of melting apple flesh. The finish is dry, zesty and moreish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Mayer am Pfarrplatz 2018 Nussberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: A notion of bruised apple on the nose verges pleasantly onto notes of dry English cider on the nose. More air adds an aromatic notion of orange peel. The palate comes in with fresh brightness and a bone-dry, slightly phenolic palate that makes the mouth water. The body is taut and concentrated and seems to have a salty well of freshness at its core that is utterly moreish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: For Those About to Rock Herrenberg
Name: Rebenhof Aubell 2017 For Those About to Rock Herrenberg White (Weinland Österreich)

Description: Still young this wine has good potential. Richly textured and balanced lemon and tropical fruits are lifted by subtle wood aging. It is a ripe wine, ready for further aging. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Garde 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This ripe wine shows yellow fruits as well as layers of citrus. The rich texture gives weight and brings out a buttery element. This wine will age well and should not be drunk before 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Chantegrive 2018  Graves

Description: Almost entirely Sémillon, this wine is rich but not heavy. Lightness comes with the surprisingly intense acidity that balances the rich apricot and honey flavors. For a second wine, this has impressive quality, ready to drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Rieussec 2017 Carmes de Rieussec  (Sauternes)

Description: This perfumed wine offers good acidity as well as great fruitiness. With 40% Sauvignon Gris in the blend, the wine's richness comes through strongly along with the essential freshness. It is ripe, with complexity, acidity and minerality. Drink the wine from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Tronquoy-Lalande 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Dense and toasty, this ripe wine offers richness that brings in creamy yellow fruit plus apple and spice flavors. A fine texture will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Valandraud 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Tantalizing hints of wood in this ripe and fruity wine convey touches of spice and point up the balance between herbal flavors and green fruits. Acidity produces a crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Couhins-Lurton 2017  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Fragrant, ripe Sauvignon Blanc gives this second wine of Smith Haut Lafitte density as well as freshness. The wine is crisply textured, still young although fruity. It will be ready from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2017 Les Hauts de Smith  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Wood aging and herbal flavors show strongly in this ripe wine. Green fruits are taut and mineral with spice, while a zesty edge pushes the wine forward. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Roche-Lalande 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Crisply herbal, this is also a ripe wine. Acidity and freshness are balanced by rich white-stone fruit and spice flavors. Over the medium term it will develop into a delicious wine. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Chantegrive 2018 Cuvée Caroline  (Graves)

Description: This zesty wine is full of apples, pears and pink grapefruit that come together in a fruit salad of flavors. With acidity and minerality, the wine is well balanced and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut Mayne 2018  Graves

Description: The high proportion of Sauvignon Gris in this wine gives it fruitiness as well as fragrance. It tames the Sauvignon Blanc and makes a beautiful wine that has balance and crispness. Drink the wine from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Monbousquet 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Made with native grapes Fiano and Greco, this opens with aromas of yellow field flower, mature stone fruit and a whiff of Mediterranean brush. The savory palate delivers ripe apricot, Bartlett pear and a mineral note evoking flint before a honeyed almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2017 Campanaro White (Irpinia)

Appellation: Malvasia delle Lipari, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of walnut and orange liqueur. Reflecting the nose, the palate, doles out candied orange zest, acacia honey and walnut while fresh acidity boosts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Hauner 2016 Carlo Hauner Passito  (Malvasia delle Lipari)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This casually named blend of 85% Chenin Blanc and 15% Muscat begins with aromas of peach, daffodil and mango, along with a touch of alkalinity on the nose. The palate is quite crisp, fresh and chalky, combining tropical coconut tones with apple and higher-toned citrus.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thacher 2018 Table Wine White (Paso Robles)

Description: Ripe and almost honeyed in its richness, this creamy wine is full of smooth Sémillon crispened with herbal acidity. Already delicious, it is beautifully fruity and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Cantelys 2017  Pessac-Léognan

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This blend of Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc is a relatively big wine in terms of body, but well-balanced, layered and complex. The subtle aromas combine mineral, dried herb and almonds, while the flavors express apricot, lemon and subtle oak spices. Best through 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Nottingham Cellars 2018 BDX Blanc White (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: San Benito, Central Coast, California, US
Description: What's not to like about a unique blend of 50% Tocai Friulano and 50% Arneis from an underappreciated region? That's especially true when aromas of Asian pear, wet stone and cinnamon lead into a mineral-laded, steely palate of yellow pear and crisp apple flesh.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bella Luna 2018 Bella Bianca Vista Verde Vineyard White (San Benito)

Description: Crisp and fruity, with some attractive herbal accents, this wine is lightly tangy. It is full of citrus flavors with hints of minerality. Wood aging gives smoothness to the texture. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Mouton Rothschild 2017 L'Aile d'Argent  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This primarily Sémillon wine from a 12-acre vineyard is rich, spicy with fruitiness along with the cinnamon flavors. The crisp herbal element is attractive, giving the wine balance and richness. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Pont de Brion 2018 Molinari  (Graves)

Description: Taut, steely and textured, this is a cool, crisp wine. With acidity and minerality all in play, the wine's long-term future is balanced by its immediate fruitiness. Drink this well-structured wine from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Pape Clément 2017  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Crisply textured, this wine has both bright fruits and a tight, mineral character that gives an edge of dryness and structure that will allow it to age further. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Garde 2017  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This fresh, fruity wine has balanced wood and fresh apple flavors. Acidity balances the ripe fruits, along with toastiness and a bright aftertaste. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Valandraud 2017 Virginie de Valandraud  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Savory and complex, this full-bodied wine blends mineral and dried herb aromas with minerally, almost meaty flavors and a rounded texture that shows off good richness. It's dry and subtle on the palate, showing an appetizing tension and tang.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Murrieta's Well 2017 The Whip White (Livermore Valley)

Description: It's amazing what a touch of Muscadelle can do to the perfume of a wine, bringing intensity, acidity, spice and touches of green fruits. This wine is crisp, lightly herbal and touched by wood aging. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Pont Saint-Martin 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This Dubourdieu wine is textured, full of acidity and fruity with crisp apples and a strong citrus, herbal character. Fruitiness is tempered by the wine's texture and fresh, tangy aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clos Floridène 2018  Graves

Description: From a small enclave in the southern Entre-deux-Mers, this wine is a crisp exercise in Sauvignons, Blanc and Gris. Lightly perfumed while also textured and herbal, it is packed with young fruit that will benefit from a few months more aging but you can drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Grand-Portail 2018  Entre-deux-Mers Haut-Benauge

Appellation: Francs Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Baked-apple and wood aromas show strongly in this ripe wine. Balancing the toastiness, the ripe fruits are complex, peach and apple flavors going along with the spice. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Puyanché 2018  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a side project from the folks at Mark Ryan. A blend of Viognier (60%) and Chardonnay (40%), with light aromas of pear, apple and spice, followed by full-bodied peach and tropical fruit flavors. There's a whole lot to like.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Lu & Oly 2018 We Sat by the Ocean White (Yakima Valley)

Description: Spring flower, wild herb and citrus aromas take center stage. The savory palate is linear and tangy, offering yellow stone fruit, tangerine drop and saline along with a rosemary accent.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Barone di Villagrande 2018 Bianco White (Salina)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: A balanced, crisp wine this is fruity, spicy and already delicious. Its green edge is balanced by rich white-peach flavors, giving the wine freshness and ripeness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Montfollet 2018 Le Valentin  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: A blend of mainly Sauvignon Blanc fermented in new wood, this wine is ripe and smoothly textured. It offers hints of herbal flavors but the main thrust is towards spice and white-fruit flavors.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Maltus 2018 Ambre de Maltus  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Falerno del Massico, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Banana and yellow stone fruit aromas mingle with whiffs of Spanish broom on this tangy white. On the rich palate, bright acidity lifts creamy white peach, Bartlett pear and hints of crushed herb.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Matilde 2018 White (Falerno del Massico)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This unique and fairly priced blend of 40% Falanghina, 40% Sauvignon Blanc, 15% Pinot Grigio and 5% Muscat starts with high-toned aromas of lemon juice, Asian pear and crushed rocks on the nose. Crisp acidity runs through the sip, where apple, lemon and chalk flavors work well together.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Graveyard NV Paso Tombstone White (Paso Robles)

Description: From the historic chateau where Montesquieu wrote “Spirit of Laws” in 1748, this bright wine with a hint of spice is already balanced. Freshness contrasts with richness as well as plenty of fruitiness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vieux Château Gaubert 2018  Graves

Appellation: Malvasia delle Lipari, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Made with 95% Malvasia delle Lipari and 5% Corinto Nero, this opens with aromas of apricot jam, ripe fig and jasmine. The juicy, balanced palate delivers chestnut honey, marmalade and a hint of dried Mediterranean herb.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Colosi 2015 Passito di Salina  (Malvasia delle Lipari)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This fragrant, juicy wine with a perfumed character is already delicious. It offers good balance between crisp fruit and texture. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Barbé 2018  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: Deliciously fruity, this is a rounded, smooth wine. Acidity and crisp flavors are subsumed by the ripe green and yellow fruits. The wine's texture gives a tangy aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Beau-Site 2018  Graves

Description: Judicious wood has given this wine a nutmeg flavor that enhances the fresh fruitiness. It is ripe and lightly textured, with good acidity as well as apple flavors. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clos Les Remparts 2018 Cuvée Jean Dubos  (Graves)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This blend of Alsace varietals has a wonderful floral perfume, ripe and juicy tree-fruit flavors from crisp apple to Anjou pear, and a rounded texture that reveals a touch of sweetness. Well-suited as an apéritif and for pairing with cheeses.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Navarro 2018 Edelzwicker (Anderson Valley)

Description: This five-acre vineyard gave the Gutmanns the incentive to change professions in 2015 and make wine. This ripe wine offers green-plum as well as baked-apple flavors. A touch of spice brought out by the muscadelle adds to the richness that is developing well. From 2020 the wine will be full and spicy.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Jouvente 2018  Graves

Description: This wine is soft, fruity and immediately attractive. Acidity and citrus flavors are given a richer edge by juicy green-plum fleshiness. Drink this wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bichon Cassignols 2018  Graves

Appellation: Francs Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Lightly structured and certainly perfumed, this wine has hints of minerality as well as a strong herbal element. It will take a while to develop fully, but it is enjoyable now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Puygueyraud 2018 Puygueraud  (Francs Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: This is a tangy, herbal wine from Jean-Baptiste Solorzano's vineyards around the castle. It is very crisp and textured. The fruits are ripe, with a real Sauvignon character, grassy and zesty. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Prieuré-les-Tours 2018 Cuvée Clara  (Graves)

Description: A subtle and shy nose just hints at earth and smoke. The palate, mellow and textured like a ripe Golden Delicious apple, picks up these earthy, slightly smoky notions and adds discreet, subtle freshness. Just enough to tone that generous, almost mellow, warm body. This will benefit from a little bottle age and knit together. Drink 2022–2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hillinger 2018 Hillside White (Burgenland)

Description: An attractive, spicy wine from a 15-acre, hand-picked vineyard, this is perfumed and full of citrus flavors. It offers an herbal touch as well as minerality, giving a textured wine that is very drinkable.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Brondelle 2018  Graves

Description: The Caumonts left Paris for Bordeaux in 2015 and are making a mark. Citrus and yellow fruits mingle in this ripe wine. A mineral edge merges into the ripe fruitiness and gives the wine balance and contrast at the same time. Drink this attractive wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Salut 2018  Graves

Description: Subtle aromas of yellow stone fruit, beeswax and citrus form the nose. The tangy palate offers yellow apple, pineapple and tangerine drop while a dollop of honey marks the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Castellaro 2018 Bianco Pomice White (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Hints of nutmeg and spice balance the smooth texture of this ripe wine. It is generous, rounded and just hints at the more herbal character of Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Monconseil-Gazin 2018 Prestige  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: This taut, tight wine from the storied de Butler family has a closed, tangy character. It will soften as this strong herbal element calms down, leaving ripe fruit, green flavors and a flavorful aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Crabitey 2018  Graves

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This deliciously crisp wine has ripe apple and pear flavors and a lively texture. It is attractive, lightly herbal and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Gardut Haut Cluzeau 2018  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: A honeyed wine dominated by Sémillon, this has golden pear and apricot flavors and a ripe feel that hints at botrytis. The wine finishes with acidity and is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Villefranche 2017  Sauternes

Description: This simple, fruity wine has a touch of spice to balance the open apple flavors. Green plums add another element of fruitiness. Drink this attractive, friendly wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château des Places 2018 Agora  (Graves)

Description: Crisply green, this is a tangy, tight wine with green asparagus as well as citrus flavors. The herbal element is also very present, offering a green aftertaste. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Magneau 2018  Graves

Description: A blend of 80% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a well-structured wine. It is young, bursting with black fruits, acidity and touches of the wood aging. This is a wine to mature for a while and to drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Tour Bicheau 2018  Graves

Description: A blend of 50% Falanghina, 25% Fiano and 25% Greco, this opens with scents of white spring flower, yellow stone fruit and a hint of vanilla. The structured palate is less expressive than the nose, suggesting toasted almond, dried pineapple and a yeasty hint of bread dough before a bitter almond finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria La Rivolta 2017 Sogno di Rivolta White (Sannio)

Description: Apricot and white-rose aromas mingle with citrus. The palate is rounded but tangy, offering yellow peach, lemon and a honeyed note before a saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Hauner 2018 Iancura White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This sumptuous wine is packed with rich yellow fruits. It is not a shy wine, rather one that has intense fruits, a mineral edge and a sense of power and spice. Drink this powerful wine from 2021,                      Roger Voss
Name: Le Nardian 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This blend of 62% Riesling and 38% Traminette is fresh and floral in aromas of lime, white blossoms, Mandarin orange and stone. This palate is bright and zesty, lifted by flavors of green apple, orange zest and white grapefruit that lead to a well-resolved finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Living Roots 2017 White (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This herbal wine dominated by Sauvignon Blanc is textured. The acidity and mineral edge are still developing, but will give a rich wine.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château les Petits Arnauds 2018  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: This dry white wine from a renowned Sauternes estate has, as so often in the region, an attractive hint of honey. Full of perfumed apple and crisper citrus flavors, it is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bastor-Lamontagne 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Spicy and fruity, this is a ripe wine. Its perfumed character brings out nutmeg as well as tangy fruitiness. Drink from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Grand Enclos du Château de Cérons
Name: Château de Cérons 2018 Grand Enclos du Château de Cérons  (Graves)

Description: While this wine has a yeasty nose, the fruit on the palate is fresh and smoothly textured. Once the wine's balance is established, it will be attractive, soft and ripe. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut Bergeron 2018 Château La Fleur des Pins  (Graves)

Description: Herbal aromas lead to a wine that is fresh and fruity. Acidity and crisp green fruits are tangy, zesty and attractive. The aftertaste is as fresh as the rest of the wine. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château La Rose Sarron 2018  Graves

Description: Vanilla and candied aromas lead the nose along with a whiff of lychee. The palate is fresher than the nose, offering yellow peach, lemon drop and crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Virgona 2018 White (Salina)

Appellation: Isola dei Nuraghi, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: A blend of 80% Vermentino and 20% Chardonnay, this has heady aromas of yellow stone fruit, honeysuckle and Mediterranean scrub. On the tangy palate, a saline note accents ripe yellow peach, honeydew melon and orange zest.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Agricola Punica 2018 Samas White (Isola dei Nuraghi)

Description: Mainly Sauvignon Blanc with just a touch of Sémillon, this wine moves immediately to freshness. It has touches of spice, a crisp texture and an edge of minerality that will soften into the wine over the next few months. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Cos d'Estournel 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This rich wine is full of ripe yellow fruits as well as sufficient acidity to balance. Weight and gravitas are freshened by green acidity that crispens the aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de la Brède 2018 Cuvée Montesquieu  (Graves)

Description: The blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon gives a wine that has light herbal hints while showing much riper green-plum and grapefruit fruitiness. It's an attractive, crisp wine that is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Saint-Robert 2017  Graves

Description: A ripe and fruity wine, this has soft acidity and a warm character. Light spice, tangy orange, lemon zest and a fresh aftertaste all go happily together. Drink this organic wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Saint-Robert 2018  Graves

Appellation: Francs Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This is a ripe wine, full of apple and peach flavors. Acidity is balanced by the rich fruitiness and touches of spice. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Les Charmes Godard 2018  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: This estate in Lussac Saint-Emilion has produced a ripe and fruity wine. Fresh lemon flavors are fragrant, crisp and attractively ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Le Blanc du Château des Landes
Name: Château des Landes 2018 Le Blanc du Château des Landes  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This is a spicy wine with a herbal character. It offers grapefruit and orange freshness along with flavors of chives and grassiness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Rahoul 2018  Graves

Description: This deeply hued wine has aromas of acacia honey, dried apricot and grilled Mediterranean herb. The linear, lean palate offers lemon drop, pineapple and honeyed notes before a bitter walnut close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: San Bartolo 2016 White (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: Colli di Salerno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A blend of Fiano, Moscato and Falanghina, this has aromas of yellow stone fruit, citrus and Mediterranean brush. The aromas carry on to the bright palate alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casa di Baal 2018 White (Colli di Salerno)

Description: A tightly textured wine, this has a strongly herbal character. Fruitiness is constrained by the taut texture and minerality. Drink the wine from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Castres 2018  Graves

Description: Crisp and fruity, this wine is fresh and flavorful. Its acidity and bright texture are attractive and accessible. The finish with hints of juicy white currants continues the theme. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Cérons 2018  Graves

Description: This 80% Sémillon, 20% Sauvignon Blanc wine from 18 acres is fruity, soft and fresh. Acidity and green-apple flavors contrast with the soft texture. Drink this open wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Peyrat 2018  Graves

Description: This wine from the Doublet family is crisp, full of green fruits and tight acidity. Its brightness brings out the mineral texture and zingy character of the aftertaste. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Tour de Calens 2018  Graves

Appellation: Isola dei Nuraghi, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Fragrant spring flower and exotic fruit aromas lead the nose. On the rounded, fruity palate, tangy acidity accompanies banana, pineapple and honeydew melon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: F.lli Puddu 2018 Gioas Su Sole White (Isola dei Nuraghi)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Herbal and aromatic, this wine is textured, tight and mineral. Its crispness is balanced by ripe apple fruits that blend well with the citrus flavors. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Le Blanc de La Croix Saint-Pierre 2018  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux
Winery: Le Blanc de La Croix Saint-Pierre

Description: This mature-tasting, low-alcohol wine is gold in color, smells lightly nutty and honey-like, and tastes like toasted almonds and tamarind. It's difficult to characterize, but is very dry, not very fruity and has an appetizing tension. No sulfites added.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lucid 2018 L.01 Skin Contact White (California)

Appellation: Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This has an extremely shy nose that eventually reveals subtle whiffs of Spanish broom and ripe white stone fruit. The round palate is also understated and subdued, offering delicate notes suggesting mature yellow apple, bitter almond a honeyed note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantine Olivella 2017 Lacrimabianco White (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Deliciously fruity, this is a bright, open wine. Lightly herbal flavors are balanced by ripe apples and white peach. The wine is still textured and probably needs to soften, so drink from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Frédignac 2018 Le Gabier  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)
